original: pra ti redh'i /🔽pra bo dh'i zhes pa rnams ga m'i sogs so //
analyzed: pra ti redh'i / pra bo dh'i zhes pa rnams ga m'i sogs so //
translated: prathidhe,🔽prabodhe.

original: bya ba la bya ba'i don la bun tum dag go //🔽bya ba gang gis bya ba'i don la bya ba'i don sbyor ba de ni bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba la bya ba'i don la bun tum dag go // bya ba gang gis bya ba'i don la bya ba'i don sbyor ba de ni bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the sense of action, the verbal roots bun and tum.🔽The sense of action is that to which the action is applied.

original: 'byung 'gyur la zhes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur la zhes pa 'jug ste /
translated: The future tense is used in the sense of the future.

original: ghanya bsgrags pa gong du'o //🔽bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la /
analyzed: ghanya bsgrags pa gong du'o // bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la /
translated: The verbal root ghañ is as above.🔽In the sense of action, the verbal root bun is used in the future tense of the near past.

original: bun dang tum dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bun dang tum dag 'gyur ro //
translated: The verbal root tum is used in the future tense of the near future.

original: s'a tsa ko bra dzi ta /🔽s'aktum pra dza ti /🔽ka ra ko bradza ti /
analyzed: s'a tsa ko bra dzi ta / s'aktum pra dza ti / ka ra ko bradza ti /
translated: sācakro bhraṣṭaḥ,🔽sāktūṃ bhraṣṭiḥ,🔽karako bhraṣṭaḥ,

original: kartu ybra dza ti /
analyzed: kartu ybra dza ti /
translated: kartūṃ bhraṣṭiḥ.

original: bya ba la zhes pa ni zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba la zhes pa ni zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is in the sense of action,

original: bhikshishye ai tya sya dzat'a /
analyzed: bhikshishye ai tya sya dzat'a /
translated: bhikṣiṣye ity asyājñā.

original: 'dir dzat'a'i sgra nye ba'i tshig tu gyur pa'i bhiksha'i bya ba brjod pa'i rkyen med do //
analyzed: 'dir dzat'a'i sgra nye ba'i tshig tu gyur pa'i bhiksha'i bya ba brjod pa'i rkyen med do //
translated: Here, the word ajñā is in the near past, but there is no suffix to express the action of bhikṣiṣye.

original: bhiksha'i don nyid kyi phyir ral pa sogs kyi bya ba'i don nyid yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bhiksha'i don nyid kyi phyir ral pa sogs kyi bya ba'i don nyid yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Because of the meaning of bhikṣiṣye, the sense of the action of bhikṣa and so on is indeed present.

original: bya ba'i don la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba'i don la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the sense of action?

original: pa ti shyi ta dh'a ba ta ste danda:/
analyzed: pa ti shyi ta dh'a ba ta ste danda:/
translated: pati-śīta-dhāvata-sta-dandaḥ.

original: 'dir dh'a ba bya ba min pa nye ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba de ni danda dang p'a t'i don ma yin te pa ti las rkyen med do //
analyzed: 'dir dh'a ba bya ba min pa nye ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba de ni danda dang p'a t'i don ma yin te pa ti las rkyen med do //
translated: Here, the so-called dhāva is a secondary suffix, and it does not mean danda or pāta, because there is no affix from pati.

original: 'o na gal te bu na'i rkyen grub zin pas bun smos pa de ni don med de tu ma'i sa 'gegs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bu na'i rkyen grub zin pas bun smos pa de ni don med de tu ma'i sa 'gegs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the condition of bhu is already established, then the mention of bhu is meaningless, because it would block the tu.

original: mi 'gyur te don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur te don tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because the meanings are different.

original: gal te mi zad pa bya ba'i dngos po la 'gyur ro zhes pas dngos po la tu ma'i rkyen dang byed pa po la ni bun yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi zad pa bya ba'i dngos po la 'gyur ro zhes pas dngos po la tu ma'i rkyen dang byed pa po la ni bun yin na /
translated: If it is said, It is in the thing to be done by the non-exhaustive, then the condition tu is for the thing, and bhu is for the agent.

original: 'o na shantring a'an dag gis gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na shantring a'an dag gis gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then it would be contradicted by the śan-triṅ-an-s.

original: gzugs @293a * //
analyzed: gzugs @293a * //
translated: The form

original: mtshungs pa'i yang na'i chog mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i yang na'i chog mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not suitable for the non-exhaustive.

original: de lta na bun smos pa las 'dir shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na bun smos pa las 'dir shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is not to be understood here from the mention of bhu,

original: bya ba'i tshig nye bar skabs la gugs mtshungs pa'i yang na'i sgrub pa yod do zhes pas so //
analyzed: bya ba'i tshig nye bar skabs la gugs mtshungs pa'i yang na'i sgrub pa yod do zhes pas so //
translated: because there is the establishment of the non-exhaustive by the verbal suffix in the present tense.

original: gal te bya ba la bya ba'i don 'gyur ni dran sogs rnams las kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bya ba la bya ba'i don 'gyur ni dran sogs rnams las kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the meaning of the verbal root were taken to be the action, then it would also be the case for memory and so on.

original: de'i phyir shantring dang a'a na dag gis bun la gnod par mi 'gyur bas bun smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shantring dang a'a na dag gis bun la gnod par mi 'gyur bas bun smos so //
translated: Therefore, since the verbal roots śan, and ān would not be impaired by the prefix u, the prefix u is mentioned.

original: dngos po brjod pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: And also the things that are expressed.

original: dngos po rjod par byed par byed do zhes pa ni dngos po brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po rjod par byed par byed do zhes pa ni dngos po brjod pa ste /
translated: The things that cause expression are called the things that are expressed.

original: bru'i btsi'o // ming las rigs ma yin pa la zhes pas ni ni'o //
analyzed: bru'i btsi'o // ming las rigs ma yin pa la zhes pas ni ni'o //
translated: The letter i is added to the verbal root by the rule: “The letter i is added to the verbal root when it is not a class.”

original: bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la dngos po rjod par byed pa'i rkyen rnams 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la dngos po rjod par byed pa'i rkyen rnams 'gyur ro //
translated: The verbal roots that are the meaning of the verbal action in the near-action case are the verbal roots that are the cause of the expression of the thing in the time of the verbal root.

original: s'a k'a ya bra dza ti /
analyzed: s'a k'a ya bra dza ti /
translated: Sā kāya prajñāti.

original: bhukta ya bra dza ti /
analyzed: bhukta ya bra dza ti /
translated: Bhu ktaya prajñāti.

original: ka ri na ya bra dza ti /
analyzed: ka ri na ya bra dza ti /
translated: Karīṇayā prajñāti.

original: 'o na ghanya sogs dngos po la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chad pa la grub pas sbyor ba brtsams pa 'dis don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ghanya sogs dngos po la'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'chad pa la grub pas sbyor ba brtsams pa 'dis don med do zhe na /
translated: Now, if one says that the explanation by the words “in the thing and so on” and so on is established, then this composition is meaningless.

original: don med pa can min te bu na dang tum dang aam zhes pa 'dis tum sogs rnams la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med pa can min te bu na dang tum dang aam zhes pa 'dis tum sogs rnams la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not meaningless, because the words tum, tum, and am would be damaged by tum, etc.

original: de'i phyir bya ba nye ba'i tshig la gha nya sogs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba nye ba'i tshig la gha nya sogs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the affix ghañ is not used for the word of proximity in the case of action.

original: las l'ang aana'o //
analyzed: las l'ang aana'o //
translated: The affix an is also used for the object.

original: bya ba la bya ba'i don gyi las nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la aana'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba la bya ba'i don gyi las nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la aana'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix an is used for the time of the verbal root in the case of the word of proximity which has the meaning of action in the object of action.

original: k'andal bo bra dza ti /
analyzed: k'andal bo bra dza ti /
translated: Kandalabhrajaṭi

original: go d'a yo bra dza ti /
analyzed: go d'a yo bra dza ti /
translated: Godāyabhrajāṭi

original: las la aana'o zhes pas grub pa la sbyor ba brtsams pa ni bun tum dag go zhes pas bun gyis gnod pa ldog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: las la aana'o zhes pas grub pa la sbyor ba brtsams pa ni bun tum dag go zhes pas bun gyis gnod pa ldog pa'i don du'o //
translated: The words bhun and tum are used for the purpose of averting the damage of bhun by the statement “The affix an is used for the object,” which establishes the application of the affix an to the object.

original: lha ma la'ang shantring dang a'a na dag sya dang lhan cig pa dag go //
analyzed: lha ma la'ang shantring dang a'a na dag sya dang lhan cig pa dag go //
translated: The words śaṃtriṅ and āna are used together with the word asya in the case of the goddess.

original: bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung ba 'gyur gyi dus rtogs par bya bzhin pa la sya dang lhan cig shrantring dang a'a na zhes pa 'di dag 'gyur zhing lhag ma'i yul la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba la bya ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la byings las 'byung ba 'gyur gyi dus rtogs par bya bzhin pa la sya dang lhan cig shrantring dang a'a na zhes pa 'di dag 'gyur zhing lhag ma'i yul la 'ang ngo //
translated: In the case of an action, the verbal root is changed to the present tense by adding sya, and in the case of a non-action, by adding ana.

original: gang du bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i don nye ba'i tshig ma yin pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o //🔽ka ri shya na bra dza ti /
analyzed: gang du bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i don nye ba'i tshig ma yin pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'o // ka ri shya na bra dza ti /
translated: When the meaning of an action or non-action is not expressed by a verbal root, it is called with remainder.🔽karisyan vrajat

original: ka ri shya ma no bra dza ti /
analyzed: ka ri shya ma no bra dza ti /
translated: karisyamanovrajat

original: han dang rit mtha' las zhes pas aita'o //
analyzed: han dang rit mtha' las zhes pas aita'o //
translated: From han and rit, the ending is ita.

original: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aa las a'a na la ma mtha'o zhes pas ma a'a ga ma'o //
translated: From a, the ending is ana.

original: lhag ma la 'ang ngo //🔽ka ri shyan /
analyzed: lhag ma la 'ang ngo // ka ri shyan /
translated: The same applies to the rest.🔽karisyat

original: ka ri shya man:/
analyzed: ka ri shya man:/
translated: karisyaman

original: pad ru dza bi sha spri sha au tsa rnams kyi ghanya'o //
analyzed: pad ru dza bi sha spri sha au tsa rnams kyi ghanya'o //
translated: pad, ruja, vis, sprisa, uca have gnya.

original: pad 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: pad 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Pad means to go.

original: ru dzo 'dzoms pa la'o //
analyzed: ru dzo 'dzoms pa la'o //
translated: Ruj means to assemble.

original: bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: bi sha rab tu 'jug pa la'o //
translated: Vis means to enter.

original: spri sha yang dag par reg pa la'o //
analyzed: spri sha yang dag par reg pa la'o //
translated: Spri means to touch.

original: autsa tshogs pa la'o //
analyzed: autsa tshogs pa la'o //
translated: Uca means to gather.

original: 'di rnams las ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these, ghañ becomes the opposite.

original: byed pa po la krita rnams zhes pa'i tshig las byed pa po la'o //
analyzed: byed pa po la krita rnams zhes pa'i tshig las byed pa po la'o //
translated: From the word kṛt for the agent, it is for the agent.

original: 'gro bar byed pa @293b po zhes ;🔽p'a da:/ 'joms par byed pa po zhes /🔽ro ga:/ 'jug par byed pa po zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa @293b po zhes ; p'a da:/ 'joms par byed pa po zhes / ro ga:/ 'jug par byed pa po zhes pa la /
translated: The agent of going is pādaḥ.🔽The agent of destroying is rogaḥ.🔽The agent of entering is veśma.

original: be sha:/ reg par byed pa po zhes la /
analyzed: be sha:/ reg par byed pa po zhes la /
translated: The agent of touching is sparśaḥ.

original: sparsha:/ tshogs par byed pa po zhes la /
analyzed: sparsha:/ tshogs par byed pa po zhes la /
translated: The agent of gathering is okaḥ.

original: aok:/ sri brtan pa dang nad dag la'o //
analyzed: aok:/ sri brtan pa dang nad dag la'o //
translated: It is for stability and disease.🔽Ghañ becomes the opposite.

original: ghanya 'jug ste aal bsgrags pa las gong du'o //
analyzed: ghanya 'jug ste aal bsgrags pa las gong du'o //
translated: Pri is for going.

original: pri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di las brtan pa dang nad kyi don la ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di las brtan pa dang nad kyi don la ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From this, ghañ becomes the opposite for the meaning of stability and disease.

original: 'tshed pa / p'a ka:/
analyzed: 'tshed pa / p'a ka:/
translated: Cooking is pākaḥ.

original: 'dor ba / tya ga:/
analyzed: 'dor ba / tya ga:/
translated: Abandoning is tyāgaḥ.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽pākaḥ.

original: p'a k'a:/ pa ka dngos po ni byings don gyi brjod bya'o //
analyzed: p'a k'a:/ pa ka dngos po ni byings don gyi brjod bya'o //
translated: The entity of pāka is the expressed meaning of the root.

original: 'o na byings don gyi bya ba de'i tshul grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'o na byings don gyi bya ba de'i tshul grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Well then, since the mode of the action of the meaning of the root is established,

original: dngos po'i yul la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig dag 'gyur ba ji ltar grub las dngos po'i don la gha n+ya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //🔽'tshed pa / p'a ka:/
analyzed: dngos po'i yul la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig dag 'gyur ba ji ltar grub las dngos po'i don la gha n+ya pha rol tu 'gyur ro // 'tshed pa / p'a ka:/
translated: The object of a noun is the meaning of the verbal root.🔽The object of a verbal root is the action.

original: 'dor ba / tya ga:/
analyzed: 'dor ba / tya ga:/
translated: The object of an action is the object.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: p'a k'a:/ pak dngos po ni byings don gyis brjod bya'o //
analyzed: p'a k'a:/ pak dngos po ni byings don gyis brjod bya'o //
translated: the object of a noun is the meaning of the verbal root.

original: 'o na byings don gyi bya ba de'i tshul grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'o na byings don gyi bya ba de'i tshul grub pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: But since the mode of the action of the meaning of the verbal root is established,

original: dngos po'i yul la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig dag 'gyur ba ji ltar grub ce na ;
analyzed: dngos po'i yul la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig dag 'gyur ba ji ltar grub ce na ;
translated: how is it established that the words for two and many are used for the object of a noun?

original: 'di yod mo 'on kyang byings kyi don gnyis dag gi cha shas la 'jug pa'i gcig gi don gyi tshul grub pa yod pa'i tshul de la dkyus ma'i rang bzhin las tshul grub par bya ba'i cha shas su gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yod mo 'on kyang byings kyi don gnyis dag gi cha shas la 'jug pa'i gcig gi don gyi tshul grub pa yod pa'i tshul de la dkyus ma'i rang bzhin las tshul grub par bya ba'i cha shas su gsungs so //
translated: Although this is so, the mode of the meaning of one is established in relation to the parts of the two meanings of the verbal root. In that mode, the parts to be established as the mode are stated to be the nature of the base.

original: gang ma grub pa'i gzugs de la bsgrub par bya ba ghanya la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams te /
analyzed: gang ma grub pa'i gzugs de la bsgrub par bya ba ghanya la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams te /
translated: The conditions of the suffix gnya and so on are for that which is not established.

original: de la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po tshig gis ji ltar grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po tshig gis ji ltar grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it be established by the words of the two and the words of the many?

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i byed pa can la'ang ming la'o /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i byed pa can la'ang ming la'o /
translated: Also, in the case of the non-agent, the affix ghañ is added to the nominal stem.

original: zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long vowel is by ghañ.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by non-agent?

original: byed pa can sgrub pa la byings las ming gi yul la ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa can sgrub pa la byings las ming gi yul la ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the affix ghañ added to the nominal stem in the formation of the agent, it becomes ghañ.

original: de rab tu byed do zhes /
analyzed: de rab tu byed do zhes /
translated: It is thoroughly done,🔽prakaraḥ.

original: pra k'a ra:/ de las za bar byed do zhes /
analyzed: pra k'a ra:/ de las za bar byed do zhes /
translated: It is eaten,🔽āhāraḥ.

original: a'a ha ra:/ thung ngu'i ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: a'a ha ra:/ thung ngu'i ring po'o zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: The long vowel is by ghañ.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by non-agent?

original: sgra 'byin no zhes /
analyzed: sgra 'byin no zhes /
translated: It is uttered,🔽nādaḥ.

original: na da:/ pa tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir aa tsa'o //
analyzed: na da:/ pa tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir aa tsa'o //
translated: Because of the very pa and so forth, it is ācaḥ.

original: ming la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ming la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by in the case of the nominal stem?🔽It is done,🔽kṛtaḥ.

original: karta bya:/ ta bya aa n'i ya dag go zhes pas las la ta bya'o //
analyzed: karta bya:/ ta bya aa n'i ya dag go zhes pas las la ta bya'o //
translated: The affix ta is added to the nominal stem.

original: dri dang dzri dag las byed pa la ghanya bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: dri dang dzri dag las byed pa la ghanya bshad par bya ste /
translated: From the words dri and jri, the affix ghañ is explained for the agent.

original: 'di rnams kyis 'jig par byed do zhes /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis 'jig par byed do zhes /
translated: It is destroyed by these,🔽ghātaḥ.

original: d'a ra:/ 'dis lang tsho nyams so zhes /
analyzed: d'a ra:/ 'dis lang tsho nyams so zhes /
translated: DARA means youth has passed.

original: dza ra:/ dri 'jigs pa la'o //
analyzed: dza ra:/ dri 'jigs pa la'o //
translated: JARA means fear of smell.

original: dzr'isha lang tsho nyams pa la'o //
analyzed: dzr'isha lang tsho nyams pa la'o //
translated: JARSA means youth has passed.

original: ghanya'o // 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: ghanya'o // 'phel ba'o //
translated: GHNA means increase.

original: skyes pa la ming la zhes pa'i gha'i rkyen 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la ming la zhes pa'i gha'i rkyen 'gegs pa'o //
translated: In the case of a male name, the GHA affix is blocked by the word name.

original: thams cad las yongs @294a * //
analyzed: thams cad las yongs @294a * //
translated: All means completely.

original: su 'jal ba la'o //
analyzed: su 'jal ba la'o //
translated: It means to measure.

original: gang gis 'jal bar byed pa de ni yongs su 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'jal bar byed pa de ni yongs su 'jal ba'o //
translated: That by which one measures is the complete measure.

original: dngos po la byed pa po ma yin pa dang byed pa can la zhes pa gnyig 'jug ste /
analyzed: dngos po la byed pa po ma yin pa dang byed pa can la zhes pa gnyig 'jug ste /
translated: In the case of a thing, the affix is not added to the agent, and in the case of an agent, the affix is added to both.

original: kritya dang yut dag gzhan la yang ngo zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
analyzed: kritya dang yut dag gzhan la yang ngo zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
translated: The Kriya and Yuta affixes are also added to others. This is above.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i dbang las kha cig tu dngos po la dang kha cig tu las la sogs pa la rkyen no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i dbang las kha cig tu dngos po la dang kha cig tu las la sogs pa la rkyen no //
translated: Due to the power of verbal expression, in some cases the affix is added to the thing, and in some cases to the action, etc.

original: yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug bzhin pa na /
analyzed: yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug bzhin pa na /
translated: While engaging in complete measurement,

original: byings thams cad pa las ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings thams cad pa las ghanya pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: from all roots, GHA becomes PHA.

original: aa la 'gegs pa'o //🔽sarba tra ni shtsa ya:/
analyzed: aa la 'gegs pa'o // sarba tra ni shtsa ya:/
translated: A is blocked.🔽SARVATRA means everywhere.

original: shi shpa ba:/ tsi nya sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: shi shpa ba:/ tsi nya sogs pa la'o //

analyzed: pra'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la graha las srab mngon par brjod par ghanya yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: Pra, in the near-word, is from graha, and ghañ is added.

original: rta la sogs pa rnams kyi sna thag gi don ni sra ba po //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa rnams kyi sna thag gi don ni sra ba po //
translated: The meaning of the reins of horses and so on is firm.

original: pra graha:/ pra graha:/
analyzed: pra graha:/ pra graha:/
translated: pragraha

original: pri no ti las sgri ba g-yogs la'o //
analyzed: pri no ti las sgri ba g-yogs la'o //

original: pra la zhes kho na'o //🔽pra'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la brinya sgrib pa la'o zhes pa 'di las sgrib g-yogs kyi don la ghanya yang na pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pra la zhes kho na'o // pra'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la brinya sgrib pa la'o zhes pa 'di las sgrib g-yogs kyi don la ghanya yang na pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: pra la zhes kho-na'o.🔽pra'i sgra nye-ba'i tshig la bri snyoms-pa la-'o zhes pa 'di las sgrib-pa-g.yogs-kyi don la gnyan yang-na phar 'gyur ro.🔽pravaram

original: pra ba ra:/ pra ba ra:/🔽thung ngu'i ring po'o //
analyzed: pra ba ra:/ pra ba ra:/ thung ngu'i ring po'o //
translated: pravaram

original: sgrib g-yogs kyi khyad par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs kyi khyad par brjod pa ste /

original: sgrib g-yogs tsam ni ma yin no //🔽sgrib g-yogs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib g-yogs tsam ni ma yin no // sgrib g-yogs la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: sgrib-pa-g.yogs-tsam ni ma yin no.🔽sgrib-pa-g.yogs la zhes pa ci zhe na.

original: pra ba ra:/ aa la'o //
analyzed: pra ba ra:/ aa la'o //
translated: pravaram a la'o.

original: pa ri la bhu las ma gus pa la'o //
analyzed: pa ri la bhu las ma gus pa la'o //
translated: parila bhu las ma gus-pa la'o.

original: pa ri'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la bh'u las ma gus pa la 'jug bzhin pa la ghanya yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa ri'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la bh'u las ma gus pa la 'jug bzhin pa la ghanya yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: par-i'i sgra nye-ba'i tshig la bhu las ma gus-pa la 'jug bzhin pa la gnyan yang-na 'gyur ro.

original: ma gus pa ni gus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma gus pa ni gus pa med pa'o //
translated: ma gus-pa ni gus-pa med-pa'o.

original: pa ri bh'a ba:/
analyzed: pa ri bh'a ba:/
translated: paribhavam

original: po ra bha ba:/🔽a'ang la ru slu dag las so //
analyzed: po ra bha ba:/ a'ang la ru slu dag las so //
translated: porabhavam🔽ang la ru slu dag las so.

original: a'ang @295b nye ba'i tshig la ru sgra la'o //
analyzed: a'ang @295b nye ba'i tshig la ru sgra la'o //
translated: ang nye-ba'i tshig la ru sgra la'o.

original: slu 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di dag las ghanya yang na 'gyur ro //🔽a'a ra ba:/ a'a ra ba:/
analyzed: slu 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di dag las ghanya yang na 'gyur ro // a'a ra ba:/ a'a ra ba:/
translated: The word to go is from the root gam.🔽Ārava! Ārava!

original: a'a sla ba:/ a'a sla ba:/
analyzed: a'a sla ba:/ a'a sla ba:/
translated: Āsrava! Āsrava!

original: tsi las lag pas len pa la'o //
analyzed: tsi las lag pas len pa la'o //
translated: The word to take is from the root ci.

original: lag pas kun nas len pa ni lag pas len pa'o //
analyzed: lag pas kun nas len pa ni lag pas len pa'o //

original: lag pas len pa'i yul tsi no ti las ghanya pha rol du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pas len pa'i yul tsi no ti las ghanya pha rol du 'gyur ro //
translated: The word to take is from the root ci, and the word to grasp is from the root ghañ.

original: pushpa pra tsa ya:/
analyzed: pushpa pra tsa ya:/
translated: Puṣpapracāya!

original: tha la pra tsa ya:/
analyzed: tha la pra tsa ya:/
translated: Thalapracāya!

original: lag pas len pa smos pa ni so so nye bar mtshon par byed pa ste /
analyzed: lag pas len pa smos pa ni so so nye bar mtshon par byed pa ste /
translated: The word to take is used to illustrate each individual [root].

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not apply here.

original: bi ksha shi ker ra pa la pra tsa yam ka ro ti /
analyzed: bi ksha shi ker ra pa la pra tsa yam ka ro ti /
translated: Vikṣaśikerapa lapracāyaṃ karoti.

original: ni'i sgra las rku ba la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra las rku ba la mi 'gyur te /
translated: The word to steal is not from the root ni.

original: pushpa pra tsa yam ka ra ti tsoormi na /
analyzed: pushpa pra tsa yam ka ra ti tsoormi na /
translated: Puṣpapracāyaṃ karotīti cūrmin.

original: lus dang gnas dag la dang po'i ka'i 'ang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dag la dang po'i ka'i 'ang ngo //
translated: The word to take is used for the body and for the place, and the first ka is also [used].

original: 'di la gnas so zhes gnas so //
analyzed: 'di la gnas so zhes gnas so //
translated: Here, to take means to take up, and to take is from the root ci.

original: tsi no ti las lus dang gnas kyi don la ghanya 'gyur zhing tsi no ti'i dang po gang yin pa de ka nyid do //
analyzed: tsi no ti las lus dang gnas kyi don la ghanya 'gyur zhing tsi no ti'i dang po gang yin pa de ka nyid do //
translated: The word to take is from the root ci, and the word to grasp is from the root ghañ. The first of ci is the same as ka.

original: k'a ya:/ ni k'a ya:/
analyzed: k'a ya:/ ni k'a ya:/
translated: kāyaḥ, nikāyaḥ.

original: phung por byed pa'i don la yang ghanya 'dod cing ka nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: phung por byed pa'i don la yang ghanya 'dod cing ka nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The meaning of “collection” is also ghana, and it is also ka.

original: go ma ya ni k'a ya:/
analyzed: go ma ya ni k'a ya:/
translated: Gomayaḥ, nikāyaḥ.

original: 'o na de ltar na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na /
translated: But in that case,

original: kashtha ni tsa ya:/
analyzed: kashtha ni tsa ya:/
translated: kṣaṇāḥ, cayāḥ.

original: ci zhe na /🔽brjod par bya ste mang po nyid tsam brjod par 'dod kyi phung por byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci zhe na / brjod par bya ste mang po nyid tsam brjod par 'dod kyi phung por byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: What is it?🔽It is said that only the mere plurality is intended, not a collection.

original: 'dus pa la'ang aootta r'a dhar++ya ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa la'ang aootta r'a dhar++ya ma yin pa la'o //
translated: In an assembly, too, it is not uttarādharāḥ, but uttarāḥ, adharāḥ.

original: autta ra dang aa dha re da ni autta ra dang aa dha ra'o //
analyzed: autta ra dang aa dha re da ni autta ra dang aa dha ra'o //
translated: Uttare and adhare are uttarā and adharā.

original: de'i dngos po ni aootta r'a dhar++ya'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni aootta r'a dhar++ya'o //
translated: The state of that is uttarādharā.

original: de nas nanya'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas nanya'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Then, the collection of nanas.

original: aootta r'a dhar++ya ma yin pa'i 'dus pa mngon par brjod pa la rtsi no ti las ghanya 'gyur zhing dang po'i 'ang ka nyid do //
analyzed: aootta r'a dhar++ya ma yin pa'i 'dus pa mngon par brjod pa la rtsi no ti las ghanya 'gyur zhing dang po'i 'ang ka nyid do //
translated: In the expression of an assembly that is not uttarādharā, ghana comes from notti, and the initial is ka itself.

original: srog chags kyi tshogs la ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags kyi tshogs la ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: In the collection of living beings, it is an assembly.

original: de'ang skabs gnyis dag las 'jug pa gcig gi autta ra aa dhar yang na'o //
analyzed: de'ang skabs gnyis dag las 'jug pa gcig gi autta ra aa dhar yang na'o //
translated: Moreover, from the two occasions, it is one engagement. Uttare adharāḥ, ca.

original: de la autt nag aa dha ra'i tshogs las gzung bar bya ste der 'dus pa brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la autt nag aa dha ra'i tshogs las gzung bar bya ste der 'dus pa brjod pa la'o //
translated: The word uttarādhara is to be taken from the group of Utta, and it is to be compounded with the word samāja.

original: brahma na ni k'a ya:/
analyzed: brahma na ni k'a ya:/
translated: Brahmaṇakāyaḥ.

original: aoott ra dhar++ya ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aoott ra dhar++ya ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of uttarādhara?

original: shva ni tse ya:/
analyzed: shva ni tse ya:/
translated: Śvanicaye.

original: aala'o // dbyangs dang bri gri ga mi grah rnams kyi aala'o //
analyzed: aala'o // dbyangs dang bri gri ga mi grah rnams kyi aala'o //
translated: Al. The al of the vowels, and of the consonants, and of the words graha and gṛha.

original: byings dbyangs kyi mtha' can las dang / bri dang tri dang ga mi dang graha rnams las kyang aal pha rol tu 'gyur zhing ghanya 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: byings dbyangs kyi mtha' can las dang / bri dang tri dang ga mi dang graha rnams las kyang aal pha rol tu 'gyur zhing ghanya 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The al is from the root that ends with a vowel, and also from the consonants tra and gra and gṛha, and it is a negation of the gha.

original: dbyangs mtha' las /
analyzed: dbyangs mtha' las /
translated: From the end of the vowel.🔽 Cayaḥ.

original: tsa ya:/ dza ya:/
analyzed: tsa ya:/ dza ya:/
translated: Jayaḥ.🔽 Nabhaḥ.

original: na ba:/ kri rnam par bskyod pa la'o //
analyzed: na ba:/ kri rnam par bskyod pa la'o //
translated: Kri. In the sense of to shake.🔽 Varā.

original: ba ra:/ da ra:/
analyzed: ba ra:/ da ra:/
translated: Darā.

original: ga ma:/ gra ha:/
analyzed: ga ma:/ gra ha:/
translated: Gamaḥ.

original: bri dang tri dag dbyangs kyi mtha' can nyid kyis grub pa la slar yang nye bar blangs pa ni ri yig gi mtha' can rnams kyi bri dri dag kho na las aal 'gyur gyi gzhan rnams las ma yin no //
analyzed: bri dang tri dag dbyangs kyi mtha' can nyid kyis grub pa la slar yang nye bar blangs pa ni ri yig gi mtha' can rnams kyi bri dri dag kho na las aal 'gyur gyi gzhan rnams las ma yin no //
translated: Grahaḥ. The al is established by the end of the vowel itself, and the repetition is from the consonants tra and gra that end with the letter ri, but not from the others.🔽 By that.

original: des na / k'a ra:/
analyzed: des na / k'a ra:/
translated: Kāraḥ.

original: h'a ra:/ du kriny byed pa la'o //
analyzed: h'a ra:/ du kriny byed pa la'o //
translated: HARA, to the act of taking.

original: hrinya 'phrog pa la'o //
analyzed: hrinya 'phrog pa la'o //
translated: HRIM, to the act of stealing.

original: shr'in ti las rlung dang yi ge dang rgyu @296a * //
analyzed: shr'in ti las rlung dang yi ge dang rgyu @296a * //
translated: SHRIM, to the act of taking wind, letter, and sign.

original: mtshan gyi don rnams la aal mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mtshan gyi don rnams la aal mi 'dod do //
translated: The meaning of the sign is to be understood as “to be worn.”

original: rgyu mtshan ni g+yogs pa'o //🔽sh'a ro b'a yu: //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni g+yogs pa'o // sh'a ro b'a yu: //
translated: The sign is that which is worn.🔽SHAROVAVAH.

original: sha ro barna:/ n'i sha ra:/
analyzed: sha ro barna:/ n'i sha ra:/
translated: SHAROVARNAM.

original: thung ngu'i ring po nyid di //🔽nyer bsgyur ; a a'a di'i'o //🔽aal zhes pa 'jug ste pa ri la da'o zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
analyzed: thung ngu'i ring po nyid di // nyer bsgyur ; a a'a di'i'o // aal zhes pa 'jug ste pa ri la da'o zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
translated: The short is long.🔽The prefixes are A, A, and so forth.🔽The suffix AL is added to the word PARI.

original: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la aa di las aal pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la aa di las aal pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix AL is added to the word PARI.

original: pra gha sa:/ ghany aal dag la gha si'o zhes pas gha sir bsgyur ro //
analyzed: pra gha sa:/ ghany aal dag la gha si'o zhes pas gha sir bsgyur ro //
translated: The suffix GHA is added to the words PRAGHA and GHA.

original: nyer bsgyur la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: gh'a sa:/ snga ma bzhin du aa di'i gha si'o /
analyzed: gh'a sa:/ snga ma bzhin du aa di'i gha si'o /
translated: The suffix GHA is added to the word GHA.

original: ni nye ba'i tshig la aa di las aana'i rkyen yang na bshad par bya ste /🔽n+ya d'a:/ ni gha sa:/
analyzed: ni nye ba'i tshig la aa di las aana'i rkyen yang na bshad par bya ste / n+ya d'a:/ ni gha sa:/
translated: The suffix AN is added to the word A and so forth.🔽The suffix AN is added to the word A and so forth.

original: phyogs gcig la aala'o//
analyzed: phyogs gcig la aala'o//
translated: The suffix AL is added to the word EKA.

original: pra s'am dag la ma di las dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: pra s'am dag la ma di las dga' ba la'o //
translated: Pra or sam + mati = pramada, delight.

original: pra dang sam dag nye ba'i tshig la madi las dga' ba mngon par brjod pa la aal 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pra dang sam dag nye ba'i tshig la madi las dga' ba mngon par brjod pa la aal 'gyur ro //
translated: Pra and sam, when they are prefixes, + mati = pramada, delight, in the expression of joy.

original: pra mad:/ sam mada:/
analyzed: pra mad:/ sam mada:/
translated: Pramada, sammada.

original: dga' ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of delight?

original: pra m'ad:/ nyer bsgyur med pa la bya dhi dza pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: pra m'ad:/ nyer bsgyur med pa la bya dhi dza pa dag gi'o //

original: nyer bsgyur med par gyur pa las moda las aal 'gyur zhing bya dha dang zhas dag las kyang ngo //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med par gyur pa las moda las aal 'gyur zhing bya dha dang zhas dag las kyang ngo //
translated: When there is no prefix, from mati, by dhijapa, and also from dhi and ja.

original: ma da:/ byadha:/ dzap:/
analyzed: ma da:/ byadha:/ dzap:/
translated: Mad, dhi, ja.

original: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of when there is no prefix?

original: pra m'a da:/ a'a by'a dha:/🔽au pa dz'a pa:/
analyzed: pra m'a da:/ a'a by'a dha:/ au pa dz'a pa:/
translated: Pramada, avadha, upaja.

original: svan has dag gi yang na'o //
analyzed: svan has dag gi yang na'o //
translated: Also from svana and has.

original: nyer sgyur med par gyur pa la svan dang has dag las aal yang na 'gyur ro //🔽sva na:/ sva na:/
analyzed: nyer sgyur med par gyur pa la svan dang has dag las aal yang na 'gyur ro // sva na:/ sva na:/
translated: Also from svana and has, when there is no prefix, by am.🔽Svana, svana.

original: ha sa:/ ha sa:/
analyzed: ha sa:/ ha sa:/
translated: Has, has.

original: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of when there is no prefix?

original: pra svan:/ pra h'asa:/
analyzed: pra svan:/ pra h'asa:/
translated: Pramada, prahas.

original: sam ni au ba'i rnams la'ang yam las so //
analyzed: sam ni au ba'i rnams la'ang yam las so //
translated: Also from sam, ni, upa, by yam.

original: nyer bsgyur med par gyur pa la yam las aal yang na 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med par gyur pa la yam las aal yang na 'gyur zhing /
translated: The suffix -ya becomes -ya in the absence of a prefix.

original: sam dang ni dang au pa dang bi rnams nye ba'i tshig la'ang ngo /
analyzed: sam dang ni dang au pa dang bi rnams nye ba'i tshig la'ang ngo /
translated: The suffixes -ma, -ni, -upa, and -vi are also used for the near locative.🔽ya-ma🔽ya-m

original: ya ma:/ y'am:/ sam ya ma:/
analyzed: ya ma:/ y'am:/ sam ya ma:/
translated: sa-ma-ya-ma

original: sam y'a ma:/ ni ya ma:/🔽ni y'a ma:/ au pa ya ma:/
analyzed: sam y'a ma:/ ni ya ma:/ ni y'a ma:/ au pa ya ma:/
translated: sa-ma-ya-m🔽ni-ya-ma🔽ni-ya-m🔽upa-ya-ma

original: au pa y'a ma:/
analyzed: au pa y'a ma:/
translated: upa-ya-m🔽vi-ya-ma

original: bi ya ma:/ bi y'a ma:/
analyzed: bi ya ma:/ bi y'a ma:/
translated: vi-ya-m

original: ni la gad nad pa la svan rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ni la gad nad pa la svan rnams kyi'o //
translated: The suffixes -gad, -nad, -patha, and -svan are for the near locative.

original: ni'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la gad dang nad dang patha dang svan las aal yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ni'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la gad dang nad dang patha dang svan las aal yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix -ni becomes -gad, -nad, -patha, or -svan in the near locative.🔽ni-gad

original: ni ga da:/ ni g'a da:/
analyzed: ni ga da:/ ni g'a da:/
translated: ni-gad🔽ni-nad

original: ni na da:/ ni n'a da:/
analyzed: ni na da:/ ni n'a da:/
translated: ni-nad🔽ni-patha

original: ni pa th'a:/ ni p'a tha:/
analyzed: ni pa th'a:/ ni p'a tha:/
translated: ni-patha🔽ni-svan

original: ni sva na:/ ni sv'a na:/
analyzed: ni sva na:/ ni sv'a na:/
translated: ni-svan

original: nyer bsgyur med pa zhes pa 'dir sprel bar mi bya ste rnam pa gzhan du na svan has dag di zhes svan smos pa don med par 'gyur ba' phyir ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa zhes pa 'dir sprel bar mi bya ste rnam pa gzhan du na svan has dag di zhes svan smos pa don med par 'gyur ba' phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in the absence of a prefix” should not be connected here, otherwise it would be meaningless to mention -svan in the phrase “-svan-ha-di.”

original: kva na'iste pi wang la'o //
analyzed: kva na'iste pi wang la'o //
translated: -kawi is for a lute.

original: ni la zhes pa 'jug cing nyer bsgyur med pa zhes pa dang yang na zhes pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: ni la zhes pa 'jug cing nyer bsgyur med pa zhes pa dang yang na zhes pa'ang ngo //
translated: ni is a particle and also means “without a prefix” or “also.”

original: ni nye ba'i tshig dang nyer bsgyur med pa la'ang ngo //
analyzed: ni nye ba'i tshig dang nyer bsgyur med pa la'ang ngo //
translated: ni is also a particle and means “without a prefix.”

original: kvan ti las pi wang gi yul @296b la'ang aal yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kvan ti las pi wang gi yul @296b la'ang aal yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: kaṇṭha is also the domain of a lute.🔽ni kaṇ

original: ni kva na:/ ni kv'a na:/
analyzed: ni kva na:/ ni kv'a na:/
translated: ni kaṇ🔽kaṇ

original: kva na:/ kv'a na:/
analyzed: kva na:/ kv'a na:/
translated: kaṇ🔽kalyāṇa-prakaṇavāṇi

original: kalyana pra kva na b'i n'a /
analyzed: kalyana pra kva na b'i n'a /
translated: kalyāṇa-prakaṇavāṇi

original: kalyanaprakv'anab'in'a / kvana'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: kalyanaprakv'anab'in'a / kvana'i sgra'i don to //
translated: means “the sound of kaṇ.”

original: pa na las yongs su 'jal ba la rtag tu'o /
analyzed: pa na las yongs su 'jal ba la rtag tu'o /
translated: pana means “always” in the sense of “measuring.”

original: yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug bzhin pa'i ban las aal rtag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug bzhin pa'i ban las aal rtag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: baṇa means “always” when used in the sense of “entering into measuring.”

original: tha snyad kyi rtsa ba'i sgra'i don dang yongs su 'jal ba dag la khu tshur 'gengs pa de'i 'di mngon par brjod pa'o /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rtsa ba'i sgra'i don dang yongs su 'jal ba dag la khu tshur 'gengs pa de'i 'di mngon par brjod pa'o /
translated: The expression of this is the clenched fist of the root words and the measuring of conventions.

original: pana ; yongs su 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: pana ; yongs su 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “measuring”?🔽vāṇa

original: b'a na:/ glaha cho lo'i skugs rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: b'a na:/ glaha cho lo'i skugs rnams la'ang ngo //
translated: also means “the dice of a game of chance.”

original: cho lo'o skugs kyi yul la 'jug bzhin pa'i don la glaha dman pa la'o zhes pa 'di las aal 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho lo'o skugs kyi yul la 'jug bzhin pa'i don la glaha dman pa la'o zhes pa 'di las aal 'gyur ro //
translated: The word al is formed from the word glaha, meaning “to enter into the domain of gambling,” with the addition of the suffix al.

original: aaksha sya gla ha:/
analyzed: aaksha sya gla ha:/
translated: The word akṣa means “dice.”

original: skugs so zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: skugs so zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The word akṣa means “to gamble.”

original: nyer bsgyur la d'a las ki'o //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur la d'a las ki'o //
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga da.

original: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la d'i ming can las ki ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur nye ba'i tshig la d'i ming can las ki ru 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga da which is a near word.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang po las thob pa ni //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang po las thob pa ni //
translated: The first from the root is the object of giving.

original: a'a di:/ sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: a'a di:/ sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: The agent is the one who accomplishes.

original: bidhi:/ aantar gyi sgra nye ba'i tshig las kyang ki 'dod de /
analyzed: bidhi:/ aantar gyi sgra nye ba'i tshig las kyang ki 'dod de /
translated: The affix ki is also desired from the near word antara.

original: gzhan 'dzin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'dzin no //
translated: It is the other holder.

original: aantadhi:/ las la gzhi la 'ang ngo //
analyzed: aantadhi:/ las la gzhi la 'ang ngo //
translated: The object of the action is also the basis.

original: las nye ba'i tshig la'ang d'a'i ming can las gzhi'i don la ki'i rkyen du gyur to //
analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la'ang d'a'i ming can las gzhi'i don la ki'i rkyen du gyur to //
translated: The affix ki is also added to the near word of the action from the affix da which has the meaning of basis.

original: 'di la chub brten to zhes /
analyzed: 'di la chub brten to zhes /
translated: It is said that this is based on that.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga ja.

original: dza la dhi:/ sha ra dhi:/🔽bud med la kti'o //
analyzed: dza la dhi:/ sha ra dhi:/ bud med la kti'o //
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga śa.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga gha.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga a.

original: byings las bud med kyi yul la kt'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings las bud med kyi yul la kt'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga kṛ.

original: ghanya dang aa la dag 'gegs pa'o //🔽kri ti:/ tsi tri:/
analyzed: ghanya dang aa la dag 'gegs pa'o // kri ti:/ tsi tri:/
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga ci.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga stu.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga sa.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga ha.

original: stu ti:/ s'a ti he ti y'u ti dz'u ti rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: stu ti:/ s'a ti he ti y'u ti dz'u ti rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The affix ki is added to the upasarga yu.🔽The affix ki is added to the upasarga ju.🔽These sounds

original: sgra 'di rnams @298a * //🔽kti'i rkyen tshig phrad de /
analyzed: sgra 'di rnams @298a * //🔽kti'i rkyen tshig phrad de /
translated: are near words with the affix ki.

original: s'a ti:/ sho mtha'i zhes pa 'di'i dya ti sya ti zhes pas ai nyid thob pa la /
analyzed: s'a ti:/ sho mtha'i zhes pa 'di'i dya ti sya ti zhes pas ai nyid thob pa la /
translated: SĀTI.🔽The word śo-māti is derived from the word dyati-syati, and the i is obtained by the rule.

original: ti'i rkyen tshig phrad do //
analyzed: ti'i rkyen tshig phrad do //
translated: The suffix ti is a sandhi consonant.🔽HETI.

original: he ti:/ hi 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di yon tan yang na'o //
analyzed: he ti:/ hi 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di yon tan yang na'o //
translated: This is derived from hi, “to go,” and the ya is a secondary suffix.🔽YUTI.

original: yu ti:/ dzu ti:/
analyzed: yu ti:/ dzu ti:/
translated: JUTI.

original: yu bsre ba la'o zhes pa 'di mdo'i ring po tshig phrad do //
analyzed: yu bsre ba la'o zhes pa 'di mdo'i ring po tshig phrad do //
translated: This is derived from yu, “to mix,” and the u is a long vowel sandhi consonant.

original: au ti dang k'irti dag gi bklags pa don med de /
analyzed: au ti dang k'irti dag gi bklags pa don med de /
translated: The reading of the words ut and kirti is meaningless.

original: auta'i sgra shri bi aa bi ma bi zhes pa 'dir grub po //
analyzed: auta'i sgra shri bi aa bi ma bi zhes pa 'dir grub po //
translated: The word ut is established by the word śrī-avibha-ma-vi.

original: k'irti'i sgra yang k'irti aisha dag gi kti'ang ngo zhes pa 'dir'o //
analyzed: k'irti'i sgra yang k'irti aisha dag gi kti'ang ngo zhes pa 'dir'o //
translated: The word kirti is also established by the word kirti-iṣa-kat.

original: pa tsi g'ap sgra rnams las dngos po la'o //
analyzed: pa tsi g'ap sgra rnams las dngos po la'o //
translated: The words pac, ga, and pā are from the root bhū, “to be.”

original: bud med la zhes pa 'jug ste //
analyzed: bud med la zhes pa 'jug ste //
translated: They are used for a thing and a woman.

original: kri tya yut rnams zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
analyzed: kri tya yut rnams zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
translated: The words kṛtya, yuta, and so on are from the root √bhū, “to be.”

original: pa tsi dang g'a dang p'a dag sth'a rnams las dngos po'i don la kti'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa tsi dang g'a dang p'a dag sth'a rnams las dngos po'i don la kti'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix kta is formed from the words pac, ga, and pā, and the roots sthā and so on.

original: a'at las kyang ngo nyer bsgyur la zhes pas aang thob pa la'o //
analyzed: a'at las kyang ngo nyer bsgyur la zhes pas aang thob pa la'o //
translated: The suffix kta is also formed from the root √bhū, “to be,” by the rule “from āt, also.”

original: pa tsi las kyang sha rjes su 'brel pa nyid las so //
analyzed: pa tsi las kyang sha rjes su 'brel pa nyid las so //
translated: And from Pac, because of the connection with flesh.

original: pakti:/ aungg'i ti:/ pra p'i ti:/
analyzed: pakti:/ aungg'i ti:/ pra p'i ti:/
translated: Pakti, Ungati, Prapaiti,

original: samsthi ta:/ d'a m'a g'a ya ti zhes pas a'i nyid do //
analyzed: samsthi ta:/ d'a m'a g'a ya ti zhes pas a'i nyid do //
translated: Samsthiti, Damagagati.

original: tishtha ti las dya ti sya ti zhes pas ai nyid do //
analyzed: tishtha ti las dya ti sya ti zhes pas ai nyid do //
translated: From Tisthat, Dyatisya, Tisi.

original: kritya dang yut rnams gzhan la yang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las aang yang ji ltar mthong ba bzhin 'gyur te /
analyzed: kritya dang yut rnams gzhan la yang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las aang yang ji ltar mthong ba bzhin 'gyur te /
translated: And from Krit and Yut, in other cases, as the word says, Ang also becomes as seen.

original: aa bastha:/ a'astha /
analyzed: aa bastha:/ a'astha /
translated: Avashtha, Astha,

original: pradz yadz dag gi kyapa'o /
analyzed: pradz yadz dag gi kyapa'o /
translated: The kvip is of Prajyayaji.

original: pra dzi ya dzi dag las kyap 'gyur te //
analyzed: pra dzi ya dzi dag las kyap 'gyur te //
translated: From Prajyayaji, kvip becomes.

original: kti'i rkyen 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: kti'i rkyen 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The kti affix is blocked.

original: pradzya / ai dzya /
analyzed: pradzya / ai dzya /
translated: Prajya, Ijya,

original: sva pi ba dzi ya dza sog rnams kyi zhes pas sampra s'a ra na'o //
analyzed: sva pi ba dzi ya dza sog rnams kyi zhes pas sampra s'a ra na'o //
translated: And from Savip, Vajiyaja, Sokas, it is Samparasara.

original: pa rjes su 'brel pa byed par ni phyi ma la ta yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
analyzed: pa rjes su 'brel pa byed par ni phyi ma la ta yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
translated: In the connection with par, the letter ta in the following is for the sake of āgama.

original: sa ma dza /
analyzed: sa ma dza /
translated: Samaja,

original: a'as / ni shad /
analyzed: a'as / ni shad /
translated: Ā, Nishtha,

original: ni pa ti /🔽shing / su /
analyzed: ni pa ti / shing / su /
translated: Nipa,🔽Shi, Su,

original: bid / aa ti /
analyzed: bid / aa ti /
translated: Vid, Ati,

original: tsa ri / ma ni /🔽bhriny / ain rnams kyi ming la'o //
analyzed: tsa ri / ma ni / bhriny / ain rnams kyi ming la'o //
translated: Cari, Mani,🔽Bhriñ, I.

original: aadzi la sam sngon du'o //
analyzed: aadzi la sam sngon du'o //
translated: In the names of Aji, Sam, before.

original: a'as shad pat dag gi sngon du ni'o //
analyzed: a'as shad pat dag gi sngon du ni'o //
translated: Before aśa and pada, ni.

original: shing nyal pa la'o //
analyzed: shing nyal pa la'o //
translated: In śayana, lying down.

original: shuny bkru ba la'o //
analyzed: shuny bkru ba la'o //
translated: In śuñ, washing.

original: bid shes pa la'o zhes pa 'di rnams dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: bid shes pa la'o zhes pa 'di rnams dang de bzhin du /
translated: In vid, knowledge.

original: aa ti dang tsa ri dang / pa ni dang bhriny dang ain zhes pa 'di rnams las kyang ming gi yul la kyap pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ti dang tsa ri dang / pa ni dang bhriny dang ain zhes pa 'di rnams las kyang ming gi yul la kyap pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And likewise, from ati, cari, pani, bhrñ, and i, the kvip suffix is formed in the domain of nouns.

original: sa ma dzy'a /
analyzed: sa ma dzy'a /
translated: Samajya,🔽āsya,

original: a'asy'a / nishdy'a /
analyzed: a'asy'a / nishdy'a /
translated: niṣadya,

original: nipady'a / shayya /
analyzed: nipady'a / shayya /
translated: nipadya, śayyā,

original: ya la a'i ni aaya'o zhes pas aaya'o //
analyzed: ya la a'i ni aaya'o zhes pas aaya'o //
translated: and from yala, āyi.

original: sury'a / bidya /
analyzed: sury'a / bidya /
translated: From surya, vidya,

original: aa t'a ty'a /
analyzed: aa t'a ty'a /
translated: ati, and atya.

original: aati la tse kri yi ta'i mtha' las ya'i rkyen bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: aati la tse kri yi ta'i mtha' las ya'i rkyen bshad par bya'o //
translated: From ati, the suffix ya is explained from the end of ceyit.

original: des na aa t'a tya'i sgra las kyapa'o /
analyzed: des na aa t'a tya'i sgra las kyapa'o /
translated: Therefore, from the word atatyā, kvip.

original: aa'i yang dbyi'i //
analyzed: aa'i yang dbyi'i //
translated: And āyi is also a suffix.

original: aa'i aan min pa la'o zhes pas yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i aan min pa la'o zhes pas yang dbyi'o //
translated: And āyi is also a suffix, as stated by āyi anmin.

original: pa ri tsr++y'a /
analyzed: pa ri tsr++y'a /
translated: Pari-carya.

original: pa ri sngon ma nyid las tsa ri'o //
analyzed: pa ri sngon ma nyid las tsa ri'o //
translated: From pari itself, cari.

original: many'a / bhri ty'a /
analyzed: many'a / bhri ty'a /
translated: Mnaya, bhritya,🔽ityā.

original: aity'a / 'o na /
analyzed: aity'a / 'o na /
translated: Then,

original: bhri tri:/ ma na nam ma ti:/
analyzed: bhri tri:/ ma na nam ma ti:/
translated: bhrītiḥ, mananamat.

original: zhes pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: bhriti la las @298b kyi sgras 'dod pa dang blo zhespas shes par byed pa las so //
analyzed: bhriti la las @298b kyi sgras 'dod pa dang blo zhespas shes par byed pa las so //
translated: The word kṛtya is known from the desire and the mind.

original: kriny las sha'ang ngo //
analyzed: kriny las sha'ang ngo //
translated: From kṛtya, the affix ya is added.

original: kriny las kyapa'i rkyen 'gyur zhing sha'i rkyen 'ang ngo //
analyzed: kriny las kyapa'i rkyen 'gyur zhing sha'i rkyen 'ang ngo //
translated: From kṛtya, the affix ya is added, and the affix ya is added to śa.

original: kri tya / kri y'a /
analyzed: kri tya / kri y'a /
translated: kṛtyā, kṛtyā

original: bed do zhes pas sha'i rkyen no //
analyzed: bed do zhes pas sha'i rkyen no //
translated: The word kṛtyā is from the affix ya.

original: sha yig ni bying thams cad pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: sha yig ni bying thams cad pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The letter śa is like all the letters.

original: yan a'a shish dag la ya la zhes pas ai yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: yan a'a shish dag la ya la zhes pas ai yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: In yā and aśiṣ, ya is from ya.

original: 'o na / kri ta:/
analyzed: 'o na / kri ta:/
translated: Then, kṛtaḥ.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: gzhan la'ang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las so /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang ngo zhes pa'i tshig las so /

original: sarti las kyang ya'o //
analyzed: sarti las kyang ya'o //

original: sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di las ya'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sri 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di las ya'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

original: kyang yig ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyang yig ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //

original: pa ri sar++y'a /
analyzed: pa ri sar++y'a /
translated: parisaṃ

original: pa ri sngon ma nyid las ya'i rkyen no //
analyzed: pa ri sngon ma nyid las ya'i rkyen no //
translated: From parisaṃ itself, the affix ya.

original: dz'a gartti las kyang 'dod de //
analyzed: dz'a gartti las kyang 'dod de //

original: dz'a gar++y'a / aa yig kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: dz'a gar++y'a / aa yig kyang mthong ste /

original: dz'a ga r'a /
analyzed: dz'a ga r'a /

original: aitstsh'a'o // sgra 'di tshig phrad do //
analyzed: aitstsh'a'o // sgra 'di tshig phrad do //

original: aishi las dngos po'i don la sha'i rkyen dang gzhan dang 'dra bar tsha nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: aishi las dngos po'i don la sha'i rkyen dang gzhan dang 'dra bar tsha nyid kyang ngo //
translated: From iṣ, in the sense of a thing, iṭ is also like the other conditions.🔽iṭ.

original: aitstsha / ming las bdag nyid 'dod pa la zhes pa 'dir aitstsha'i sgra'i brjod pa yod pa la'o zhes pas tshig phrad don med do zhes kha cig smra'o //

translated: Some say that in the desire for the self from the name, here the expression of the iṭ sound exists, so the sandhi is meaningless.

analyzed: shansi dang rkyen las aa'o // shans'i dang rkyen las kyang aa yig rkyen du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: a'a shansi dang rkyen las kyang aa yig rkyen du 'gyur ro //

original: a'a shans'a / tsi k'arsha /
analyzed: a'a shans'a / tsi k'arsha /

original: lo l'u y'a /
analyzed: lo l'u y'a /

original: lji ba las kyang nishtha la ait dang bcas pa'i'o //
analyzed: lji ba las kyang nishtha la ait dang bcas pa'i'o //
translated: Also from jī, with iṭ, of niṣṭhā.

analyzed: lji ba la ste byings lji ba ldan pa las nishth'a ait dang bcas pa la aa'i rkyen 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bya dza:/ aa dza 'gro ba la'o zehs pa 'di bi sngon ma can no // de'i dngos po thob pa dang dngos po med pa la'ang tshig phrad do // ka sde dang po dang / bradzi:/ zhes pa'i tshig las ga nyis du 'ang mi 'gyur ro // 'dis rim par byed do zhes la / kram'a:/ 'dis kun nas 'tshong ngo zhes / a'a pa nam / 'dis 'gro ba rnams nges par 'gro zhes pa / ni ga ma:/ chos la sogs pa rnams so // kyang gi sgra las / ka sha dang nika sha dag la'ang ste der 'dar bar byed do zhes la / ka sha:/ der nges par 'byed do zhes la / ni ka sa:/ aa ba tri stri dag gi ghanya'o / aa pa'i sgra nye ba'i tshig la / tri dang stri dag las ghanya 'gyur te / skyes pa la 'jug pa'i byed pa dang gzhi dag la'o //
translated: Jha is said to be going to the people.🔽 This is the same as the previous one.🔽The word and is also used for the attainment of its state and non-state.🔽 The first of the ka group is ka.🔽 The word and is also used for the two gas.🔽 This is used for in order, and🔽krama is used for all around.🔽 This is used for going, and🔽naman is used for the people.🔽 This is used for going for sure, and🔽nigama is used for the phenomena, and so on.🔽 The word also is used for🔽kṣa and kṣa as well. It is used for trembling there.🔽 This is used for definitely separating there, and🔽nikṣa is used for the gha of avat and atri.🔽 The word ava is a prefix, and🔽gha is used for tri and stri.🔽 It is used for the action and basis that are engaged by a male.🔽🔽

analyzed: aa kh'a na:/ da'i rkyen yang mthong ste /
translated: The condition da is also seen.

original: 'dis kun nas 'joms so la /
analyzed: 'dis kun nas 'joms so la /
translated: It is said, “This completely destroys.”

original: a'a kha:/ phyogs gcig la gha'i rkyen no //
analyzed: a'a kha:/ phyogs gcig la gha'i rkyen no //
translated: In one place, the affix ghañ.🔽Ākḥan.

original: a'a kha na:/ aa dhy'a ya n+ya ya au dy'a ba sam h'a ra aa dha a'a s'a ya rnams kyang /
analyzed: a'a kha na:/ aa dhy'a ya n+ya ya au dy'a ba sam h'a ra aa dha a'a s'a ya rnams kyang /
translated: Adhyāyanīya, udhyāvasaṃhara, adhārasa.

original: ghanya'i rkyen gyi mtha' can gyi sgra 'di rnams tshig phrad do //
analyzed: ghanya'i rkyen gyi mtha' can gyi sgra 'di rnams tshig phrad do //
translated: These words ending in the affix ghañ are compound words.

original: 'di la bklag par bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: 'di la bklag par bya'o zhes pa /
translated: This should be read:

original: aa dhy'a ya:/ aa dhi sngon ma can gyi aing las ghanya'o //
analyzed: aa dhy'a ya:/ aa dhi sngon ma can gyi aing las ghanya'o //
translated: Adhyāyaḥ. From the preceding adhi, iṇ becomes ghañ.

original: skyes pa la ming la'o zhes pas gha thob pa la'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la ming la'o zhes pas gha thob pa la'o //
translated: In the name of a man, it is obtained.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: 'dis rigs pa byed do zhes la /
analyzed: 'dis rigs pa byed do zhes la /
translated: Here, he acts reasonably.

original: na+ya ya:/ ni sngon ma las ain la ghanya'o //
analyzed: na+ya ya:/ ni sngon ma las ain la ghanya'o //
translated: Nīyāt. From the preceding ni, iṇ becomes ghañ.

original: 'di la shin tu sre bar byed do zhes la /
analyzed: 'di la shin tu sre bar byed do zhes la /
translated: Here, he is very much heated.

original: aa dy'a ba:/ yu bsre ba la'o //
analyzed: aa dy'a ba:/ yu bsre ba la'o //
translated: Udhyāvat. For heating.

original: aud sngon du'o //
analyzed: aud sngon du'o //
translated: Ud is in front.

original: der sdud par byed do zhes la /
analyzed: der sdud par byed do zhes la /
translated: There, he collects.

original: sam h'a ra:/ 'di la kun @301b 'dzin par byed do zhes la /
analyzed: sam h'a ra:/ 'di la kun @301b 'dzin par byed do zhes la /
translated: Saṃhara. Here, he holds everything.

original: a'a dh'ar:/ de byed do zhes la /
analyzed: a'a dh'ar:/ de byed do zhes la /
translated: Adhārasa. There, he acts.

original: a'a ba ya:/ dra ba la ni las ghanya bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: a'a ba ya:/ dra ba la ni las ghanya bshad par bya ste /
translated: Āvayāt. In the net, the affix ghañ is explained.

original: 'dis kun du dra bar bya'o zhes la /🔽a'a n'a ya:/ dra ba zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis kun du dra bar bya'o zhes la / a'a n'a ya:/ dra ba zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: This is to be connected with the word net.🔽 Ānayiḥ.

original: a'a na ya:/ gha'i rkyen no //
analyzed: a'a na ya:/ gha'i rkyen no //
translated: The suffix gha.

original: a'i shad dur su rnams la dka' ba'i don rnams la khala'o //🔽dka' ba dang mi dka' ba'i don can rnams la zhes zlas dbye kho na gnas pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: a'i shad dur su rnams la dka' ba'i don rnams la khala'o // dka' ba dang mi dka' ba'i don can rnams la zhes zlas dbye kho na gnas pa'i 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: The words khalu, dur, and su are used for difficult meanings.🔽The word khalu is used for both difficult and easy meanings.

original: dka' ba dang dka' ba ma yin pa can zhes pa 'di dag gi don la 'jug bzhin pa'i a'i shad dang dur dang su zhes pa 'di rnams nye ba'i tshig la /
analyzed: dka' ba dang dka' ba ma yin pa can zhes pa 'di dag gi don la 'jug bzhin pa'i a'i shad dang dur dang su zhes pa 'di rnams nye ba'i tshig la /
translated: The words khalu, dur, and su are used for the meanings of these words.

original: byings las khal pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byings las khal pha rol tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The word khalu is formed from the root khal with the suffix khalu.

original: la yig ni dngos po dang las dag la kri tya k'a zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: la yig ni dngos po dang las dag la kri tya k'a zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word la has the meaning of kṛtyākara in terms of things and actions.

original: dka' ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o de ni dur gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dka' ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o de ni dur gyi khyad par ro //
translated: Difficulty is suffering, and that is a special case of dur.

original: mi dka' ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: mi dka' ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: Ease is happiness.

original: de yang a'i shat dang su'i sgra dag go //🔽aishatka ra:/ du:kar /
analyzed: de yang a'i shat dang su'i sgra dag go // aishatka ra:/ du:kar /
translated: That is also expressed by the words aśita and su.🔽Aiṣṭakaḥ.🔽 Duḥkaraḥ.🔽 Sukaraḥ.

original: su kar:/ dka' bas bya /
analyzed: su kar:/ dka' bas bya /
translated: Difficult to do.🔽

original: sla bas bya zhes pas khala'o //
analyzed: sla bas bya zhes pas khala'o //
translated: The suffix kvip is added to the root, and the affix -a is added to the root.

original: de bzhin du /🔽aishadbho dza:/ durbho dza:/
analyzed: de bzhin du / aishadbho dza:/ durbho dza:/
translated: Similarly,🔽iṣad, durbha, subha, and iṣad, dur, su are added to the roots.

original: subho dza:/ a'ishad dur su rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: subho dza:/ a'ishad dur su rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of iṣad, dur, and su?🔽kṛtsna, kārya, and duḥkha are added to the roots.

original: kritstsha na k'arya:/ dka' ba dang mi dka' ba'i don rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽ai sha tk'aryam /
analyzed: kritstsha na k'arya:/ dka' ba dang mi dka' ba'i don rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na / ai sha tk'aryam /
translated: What is the meaning of kṛtsna, kārya, and duḥkha?

original: cung zad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad ces pa'i don to //
translated: iṣṭa, kārya, and alpa are added to the roots.🔽What is the meaning of iṣṭa, kārya, and alpa?

original: 'o na a'i shat la sogs pa rnams mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ma yig a'a ga ma mi 'gyur bas kha rjes su 'brel bar byed pas ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na a'i shat la sogs pa rnams mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ma yig a'a ga ma mi 'gyur bas kha rjes su 'brel bar byed pas ci zhe na /
translated: Now, since iṣṭa and so on are not exhausted, the letter ma does not become āgama, so what is the purpose of the suffix kvip?

original: bden te phyi ma'i don du'o//🔽byed pa po dang las dag la'ang bh'u krinya dag gi'o //🔽a'i shad dur su rnams dka' ba dang dka' ba min pa'i don can rnams la byed pa po dang las nye ba'i tshig la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du bh'u dang krinya las khal 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bden te phyi ma'i don du'o// byed pa po dang las dag la'ang bh'u krinya dag gi'o // a'i shad dur su rnams dka' ba dang dka' ba min pa'i don can rnams la byed pa po dang las nye ba'i tshig la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du bh'u dang krinya las khal 'gyur ro /
translated: It is true, but it is for the sake of the future.🔽The suffixes bhu and kṛt are added to the roots for the meanings of agent and object.

original: sla bas phyug por byed /
analyzed: sla bas phyug por byed /
translated: iṣad, dur, and su are added to the roots for the meanings of difficult and not difficult. The suffixes bhu and kṛt are added to the roots for the meanings of agent and object.🔽The suffix kvip is added to the root, and the affix -a is added to the root.

original: a'i sha d'a dhyam bha bam /
analyzed: a'i sha d'a dhyam bha bam /
translated: iṣṭa, kārya, and alpa are added to the roots.

original: du radhyam / sv'adhyam bam /🔽de bzhin du //🔽a'i sha d'adhyam ka ra:/🔽du radhyam ka ra:/🔽svadhyam ka:/ a'at rnams las da ri dra ti min pa las yu'o //🔽aishad da sog 'jug cing byed pa po dang las dag ni ldog go //
analyzed: du radhyam / sv'adhyam bam / de bzhin du // a'i sha d'adhyam ka ra:/ du radhyam ka ra:/ svadhyam ka:/ a'at rnams las da ri dra ti min pa las yu'o // aishad da sog 'jug cing byed pa po dang las dag ni ldog go //
translated: duḥkham, duḥkham,

original: a'i shad sogs rnams la dka' ba dang dka' ba ma yin pa'i don can rnams nye ba'i tshig la a'a ta te a'a yig mtha' can gyi byings las yu 'gyur te /🔽da ri dr'a ti dor ba las so //🔽bde bas mthung ba /🔽a'i shatpa na:/ du: p'a na:/🔽pu p'a na:/ da ri dra ti ma yin pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽a'i shadda ri dra:/🔽kal lo // da ri tra ti'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la zhes pas a'a dbyi'o //🔽sh'as yudhi dri shidhi shi mri shi rnams kyi yang na'o //🔽a'i shat la sogs pa rnams @302a * //

original: dka' ba dang dka' ba ma yin pa'i don can rnams nye ba'i tshig la sh'a si dang yudhi dang dri shi dnag mrisha rnams las yu'i rkyen yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dka' ba dang dka' ba ma yin pa'i don can rnams nye ba'i tshig la sh'a si dang yudhi dang dri shi dnag mrisha rnams las yu'i rkyen yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: The words of the easy and the difficult meanings are formed from the affixes yū, yudhi, driśi, and mṛśa, with the suffix y added.

original: sla ba sa bstan pa ni /🔽a'i sha tstsha sa na:/
analyzed: sla ba sa bstan pa ni / a'i sha tstsha sa na:/
translated: The easy ones are taught.🔽āśacchasa

original: a'i sha tstsha sa:/🔽du: sh'a sa na:/
analyzed: a'i sha tstsha sa:/ du: sh'a sa na:/
translated: āśacchasa🔽duḥśasa🔽duḥśasa

original: du: sh'as:/ su sh'a sa na:/
analyzed: du: sh'as:/ su sh'a sa na:/
translated: suśasa

original: su sh'a sa:/ sla bas g-yul bya ba ni /
analyzed: su sh'a sa:/ sla bas g-yul bya ba ni /
translated: The easy ones are fighting.

original: a'i shadyo dha na:/
analyzed: a'i shadyo dha na:/
translated: āśayodhana🔽duḥayodhana

original: dur++yo dha na:/ su yo dha na:/
analyzed: dur++yo dha na:/ su yo dha na:/
translated: suayodhana🔽āśayodha

original: a'ishadyo dha:/ durmo dha:/
analyzed: a'ishadyo dha:/ durmo dha:/
translated: duḥayodha🔽suayodha

original: su yo dha:/ sla bas mthong ba ni /
analyzed: su yo dha:/ sla bas mthong ba ni /
translated: The easy ones are seeing.🔽āśadṛśana

original: a'i shaddarsha na:/ a'i shaddarsha:/
analyzed: a'i shaddarsha na:/ a'i shaddarsha:/
translated: āśadṛśa🔽duḥdṛśana🔽duḥdṛśa🔽sudṛśana

original: durdorsha na:/ durdarsha:/ su darsha na:/
analyzed: durdorsha na:/ durdarsha:/ su darsha na:/
translated: sudṛśa

original: su darsha:/ phyogs gcig la khal 'jug go //
analyzed: su darsha:/ phyogs gcig la khal 'jug go //
translated: The load is put on one side.

original: sla bas spyi brtol byed pa ni /
analyzed: sla bas spyi brtol byed pa ni /
translated: The easy ones are piercing.🔽āśadṛśana

original: a'i shaddharsha na:/ a'i shaddharsha:/
analyzed: a'i shaddharsha na:/ a'i shaddharsha:/
translated: āśadṛśa🔽duḥdṛśana🔽duḥdṛśa🔽sudṛśana

original: durdharsha na:/ durdharsha:/ su dharsha na:/
analyzed: durdharsha na:/ durdharsha:/ su dharsha na:/
translated: sudṛśa

original: su dharsha:/ sla bas bzod do /
analyzed: su dharsha:/ sla bas bzod do /
translated: The easy ones are enduring.

original: a'i shanmarsha:/ a'i shanmarsha:/
analyzed: a'i shanmarsha:/ a'i shanmarsha:/
translated: aiṣaṇamṛṣaḥ, aiṣaṇamṛṣaḥ.🔽durmṛṣaṇam, durmṛṣaṇam, sumṛṣaṇam,

original: durmarsha na:/ durmarsha:/ su marsha na:/
analyzed: durmarsha na:/ durmarsha:/ su marsha na:/
translated: sumṛṣaṇam.

original: su marsha:/ yang na smos pa ni kha la phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: su marsha:/ yang na smos pa ni kha la phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: Or the mention is for the purpose of applying to one side of the mouth.

original: gal te yu'i rkyen gyis lhan cig pa'i khal la gnod par byed de /
analyzed: gal te yu'i rkyen gyis lhan cig pa'i khal la gnod par byed de /
translated: If the condition of yū is to harm the mouth that is simultaneous,

original: gzugs mtshungs par grub pas yang na la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs mtshungs par grub pas yang na la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would harm the mouth that is similar in form.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: If it is like that,

original: yang na smos pa'i shes par byed pa bud med la sbyir btang ba'i phyir gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na smos pa'i shes par byed pa bud med la sbyir btang ba'i phyir gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: then the mention of yū is not for another because it is a general statement for a woman.

original: gzugs mtshungs pa'i sgrub pa yang na zhes pa gal te 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzugs mtshungs pa'i sgrub pa yang na zhes pa gal te 'gyur na /
translated: And if the proof of similar form is yū,

original: ma ning la dngos pola kta'i rkyen bzhin du'ang ghanya 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma ning la dngos pola kta'i rkyen bzhin du'ang ghanya 'gyur ro //
translated: then ghañ would also be like the condition of kta in a neuter.

original: 'dod pa'i don rnams la byed pa po gcig pa rnams la tuma'o /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rnams la byed pa po gcig pa rnams la tuma'o /
translated: For those who have the same agent in desired things, there is tum.

original: gnyi ga la yang 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: For both, there is the multiple syllable.

original: byed pa po gcig pa rnam la ste byed pa po mtshungs pa la 'dod pa'i don can gyi byings rnams nye ba'i tshig la byings las tuma'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig pa rnam la ste byed pa po mtshungs pa la 'dod pa'i don can gyi byings rnams nye ba'i tshig la byings las tuma'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix tum is added to the verbal root that expresses the desired meaning when there is a single agent.

original: aitstsha ti bhoktum /
analyzed: aitstsha ti bhoktum /
translated: Iccha-ti bhoktuṃ

original: b'anytsha ti bhoktum\/ b'anytsha 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: b'anytsha ti bhoktum\/ b'anytsha 'dod pa la'o //
translated: Vāñchati bhoktuṃ/ Vāñchati is desire.

original: byed pa po gcig pa rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig pa rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “when there is a single agent?”

original: de ba dattam bhunydza nam aitstsha ti yadznya datta:/
analyzed: de ba dattam bhunydza nam aitstsha ti yadznya datta:/
translated: Devadattaḥ bhuñjānam icchati yajñadattaḥ

original: bhu dza las da ltar ba la shantring a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
analyzed: bhu dza las da ltar ba la shantring a'a na sha zhes pas a'a na sha'o //
translated: Bhuja has the present tense ending aṃ.

original: ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //
translated: Rudha and so on have the vowel ṇa.

original: 'o na za bar byed pa dod pa'i nyid kyi phyor bya ba la bya ba'i don la wun tum dag go zhes pa 'dis tum grub pa'i phyir tum gyi tshig don med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na za bar byed pa dod pa'i nyid kyi phyor bya ba la bya ba'i don la wun tum dag go zhes pa 'dis tum grub pa'i phyir tum gyi tshig don med do zhe na /
translated: If one says, “Since this is established by the rule ‘The suffix tum is added to the verbal root that expresses the desired meaning when there is a single agent,’ the word tum is meaningless,”

original: 'di yod mod 'on kyang tuma'i rkyen bzhin bun yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yod mod 'on kyang tuma'i rkyen bzhin bun yang 'gyur ro //
translated: this is so, but like the suffix tum, vunt is also added.

original: k'a la sa ma ya be l'a nus pa'i don rnams la 'ang ngo /
analyzed: k'a la sa ma ya be l'a nus pa'i don rnams la 'ang ngo /
translated: Also, in the case of the words kālasamayabhelānu, the meaning of the root is power.

original: nus par bya ba ni nus pa ste sgra gang rnams kyi nus pa'i don de ni nus pa'i don rnams so //
analyzed: nus par bya ba ni nus pa ste sgra gang rnams kyi nus pa'i don de ni nus pa'i don rnams so //
translated: That which is to be empowered is power, and the meaning of the power of those words is the meanings of power.

original: k'a la dang sa ma ya dang be l'a zhes pa 'di rnams nye @302b ba'i tshig la dang nus pa'i don te nus pa'i don rnams la'ang byings las tum pha rol tu 'gyur ro /🔽k'a lo bhoktum\/ sa ma yo bho ktum /
analyzed: k'a la dang sa ma ya dang be l'a zhes pa 'di rnams nye @302b ba'i tshig la dang nus pa'i don te nus pa'i don rnams la'ang byings las tum pha rol tu 'gyur ro / k'a lo bhoktum\/ sa ma yo bho ktum /
translated: These words kāla, samaya, and bhelā are near-synonyms, and the meaning of the root is power. Also, in the case of the meanings of power, the suffix tum becomes parya in the case of the root.🔽Kālo bhoktuṃ, samayo bhoktuṃ,🔽bhelā bhoktuṃ, samarthobhoktuṃ,

original: bel'a bhoktum / sa martha bhoktum /
analyzed: bel'a bhoktum / sa martha bhoktum /
translated: bhoktuṃ paryāptam.

original: bhoktum paryapta:/ 'ang gi sgra las ji ltar mthong ba bzhin gzhan la yang tum 'dod de /
analyzed: bhoktum paryapta:/ 'ang gi sgra las ji ltar mthong ba bzhin gzhan la yang tum 'dod de /
translated: By the word “also,” it is desired that tum is also like what is seen in other [words].

original: bhoktu k'a ma:/ bhoktum na:/
analyzed: bhoktu k'a ma:/ bhoktum na:/
translated: Bhoktu kāmaḥ, bhoktuṃ naḥ.

original: bshad pa las tuma'i ma dbyi'o //
analyzed: bshad pa las tuma'i ma dbyi'o //
translated: The ma of tum is elided in the explanation.

original: dang po'i mtha' rnams la k'a la la sogs pa nyid la rkyen bshad do //
analyzed: dang po'i mtha' rnams la k'a la la sogs pa nyid la rkyen bshad do //
translated: The conditions are explained for the final of the first, just kāla, and so on.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it does not occur here.

original: k'a la bhuktam /
analyzed: k'a la bhuktam /
translated: Kālabhuktam.

original: zhes pa'o // 'os pa la tritsa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'os pa la tritsa'o /
translated: In the case of suitable, there is tric.

original: byed pa po la krit rnams so zhes pa'i tshig las gang byed pa po smos pa thob pa de dang de'i 'os pa'i zhes khyad par shes par bya'o //

analyzed: de b'a ya /

analyzed: de ba bhu ti:/
