original: slar yang krit kyi tshogs khyad par du byas pas ti kas gnod pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: slar yang krit kyi tshogs khyad par du byas pas ti kas gnod pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: Again, because of the special Kriyā group, the Tika is for the purpose of averting harm.

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par krit kyi skabs rkang pa lnga ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par krit kyi skabs rkang pa lnga ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary composed by the venerable Drajya, in the Kriyā section, completes the fifth verse, which is beneficial for students.

original: // / byings kyi 'grel pa la rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: // / byings kyi 'grel pa la rkyen rnams so //
translated: In the commentary on the roots, there are the conditions.

original: byings dang 'brel ba'i don bshad pa ni 'di'o //
analyzed: byings dang 'brel ba'i don bshad pa ni 'di'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning connected with the roots is this.

original: 'dir byings kyi sgra byings don la 'jug ste des na byings kyi don dang 'brel ba can gyi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mtshon par gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'dir byings kyi sgra byings don la 'jug ste des na byings kyi don dang 'brel ba can gyi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po mtshon par gyur pa la /
translated: Here, the word root refers to the meaning of the root. Therefore, in the indication of the special and general things connected with the meaning of the root,

original: krit kyi ming can gyi rkyen rnams legs par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: krit kyi ming can gyi rkyen rnams legs par 'gyur ro /
translated: the conditions having the name Kriyā become proper.

original: dus tha dad pa la byas pas byings dang 'brel bar gyur ba legs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa la byas pas byings dang 'brel bar gyur ba legs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Because it is done with regard to the different times, the things connected with the root become proper. This is the meaning.

original: aagnishto ma y'a dz'i su tro& sya dza ni t'a /
analyzed: aagnishto ma y'a dz'i su tro& sya dza ni t'a /
translated: Agniṣṭoma yaj jīṣṭraḥ asya janitā.

original: aagnishto las mchod sbyin byas zin no zhes byed pa la yadza las 'das pa la'o zhes pas 'das pa'i dus la ni ni'o //🔽dza ni t'a /
analyzed: aagnishto las mchod sbyin byas zin no zhes byed pa la yadza las 'das pa la'o zhes pas 'das pa'i dus la ni ni'o // dza ni t'a /
translated: The past time is expressed by the affix ni, as in the expression agnishtā yajñaḥ, meaning the sacrifice has been performed in the fire.

original: zhes pa dza ni las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la shvasta n'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dza ni las 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la shvasta n'i'o //
translated: The future time is expressed by the affix tva, as in the expression janitā, meaning the one who will be born.

original: de la 'das pa dang 'byung 'gyur dag tha dad pa las /🔽y'a dz'i dang dza ni t'a /
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang 'byung 'gyur dag tha dad pa las / y'a dz'i dang dza ni t'a /
translated: The past and future times are distinguished by the affixes ni and tva, respectively.🔽 The affixes yā and jā are not used because they are not proper.

original: sgra dag khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir legs pa nyid min pa thob po //🔽de la 'dis legs pa nyid bya ste /
analyzed: sgra dag khyad par can gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir legs pa nyid min pa thob po // de la 'dis legs pa nyid bya ste /
translated: This is because they are not proper for expressing the past and future times.

original: de'ang ci ltar yin na /
analyzed: de'ang ci ltar yin na /
translated: This is how it is.

original: aagnishto ma y'a dzi zhes pa 'di khyad par yin te /
analyzed: aagnishto ma y'a dzi zhes pa 'di khyad par yin te /
translated: The affix tva is used in the expression agnishtā yajñaḥ, meaning the sacrifice has been performed in the fire.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi dus yongs su dor nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi dus yongs su dor nas /
translated: When the time of the affix ni is abandoned,

original: dza ni t'a zhes pa 'di'i dus 'og tu dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: dza ni t'a zhes pa 'di'i dus 'og tu dmigs par byed do //
translated: the time of the affix tva is referred to as janitā, meaning the one who will be born.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pas aa sya su tro dza ni t'a /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pas aa sya su tro dza ni t'a /
translated: In this way, the expression asyāḥ sutro janitā is formed.

original: gang gis na /
analyzed: gang gis na /
translated: By what means?

original: aagni shto las mchod sbyin byas zin pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: aagni shto las mchod sbyin byas zin pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: By the cause of the expression agnishtā yajñaḥ, meaning the sacrifice has been performed in the fire.🔽

original: 'o na / dza ni t'a /
analyzed: 'o na / dza ni t'a /
translated: jānatā,

original: zhes pa 'di khyad par can yin /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di khyad par can yin /
translated: this is a special case.

original: a'a dz'i zhes pa 'di ma yin pa ni ci las she na /
analyzed: a'a dz'i zhes pa 'di ma yin pa ni ci las she na /
translated: How is it that this is not ā-jā?

original: brjod par bya ste kun bshad pa'i tshig ni khyad par can te bya ba gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste kun bshad pa'i tshig ni khyad par can te bya ba gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It should be said that the word “all” is a special case because it is the principal action.

original: krita'i mtha'i can ni khyad par te /
analyzed: krita'i mtha'i can ni khyad par te /
translated: The one ending in kṛt is a special case.

original: krit rnams ni byed pa po la bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir dang byed pa po yang bya ba'i gzhan dbang nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: krit rnams ni byed pa po la bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir dang byed pa po yang bya ba'i gzhan dbang nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the kṛts are formed in relation to the agent, and the agent is also dependent on the action.

original: krit smos par bya ba la rkyen gzung ba'i skabs gzhan du byas pa'i rkyen yongs @303b su gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: krit smos par bya ba la rkyen gzung ba'i skabs gzhan du byas pa'i rkyen yongs @303b su gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: The kṛt is mentioned for the purpose of including the other cases that are taken as conditions in the expression.

original: des na 'dir yang legs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir yang legs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, here also it would be correct.

original: go y'a n'a s'i tra /
analyzed: go y'a n'a s'i tra /
translated: gonyānasītaraḥ,

original: go m'an\ bha bi t'a /
analyzed: go m'an\ bha bi t'a /
translated: goman bhavati,

original: go m'an zhes da ltar ba'i dus la m'antu'o //
analyzed: go m'an zhes da ltar ba'i dus la m'antu'o //
translated: goman means “having gone” in the present tense.

original: a'a s'it da bha bi t'a zhes pa byung zin pa dang 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la'ang rkyen no //
analyzed: a'a s'it da bha bi t'a zhes pa byung zin pa dang 'byung 'gyur gyi dus la'ang rkyen no //
translated: āsīt, bhaviṣyati means “having been” and “will be” in the past and future tenses respectively.

original: de la / go m'an zhe spa 'di khyad par te da ltar ba dor nas byung zin ba dang 'byung 'gyur gyi dus dag la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la / go m'an zhe spa 'di khyad par te da ltar ba dor nas byung zin ba dang 'byung 'gyur gyi dus dag la brten pa'o //
translated: The difference between the two is this: the former is based on the present, the latter on the past and future.

original: rnam pa de bzhin du //🔽de ba datta a'a s'it\ ya sya g'a bo bhu t'a:/
analyzed: rnam pa de bzhin du // de ba datta a'a s'it\ ya sya g'a bo bhu t'a:/
translated: In the same way,🔽devadatta is a sage,

original: rnam pa de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: rnam pa de bzhin du yang /
translated: In the same way,

original: yadznya datto bha bi t'a ya bya g'a bo dha bi t'a ra:/
analyzed: yadznya datto bha bi t'a ya bya g'a bo dha bi t'a ra:/
translated: jñādatta is a sage, a wise man.

original: aa lam kha lu dag la dgag pa la kt'a yang na'o //
analyzed: aa lam kha lu dag la dgag pa la kt'a yang na'o //
translated: The suffix kta is added to alam and kalu in the sense of prohibition.

original: aa lam dang kha lu zhes pa 'di dag dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can nyi ba'i tshig dag la byings las ktv'i rkyen yang na 'gyur ro //🔽aa lam kri tv'a /
analyzed: aa lam dang kha lu zhes pa 'di dag dgag pa'i mtshan nyid can nyi ba'i tshig dag la byings las ktv'i rkyen yang na 'gyur ro // aa lam kri tv'a /
translated: These words alam and kalu, which have the characteristic of prohibition, take the kta suffix from the root in the sense of kta.🔽alam-kṛta

original: kha lu kri tv'a /
analyzed: kha lu kri tv'a /
translated: kalu-kṛta

original: 'dir byed pa khyad par can te /
analyzed: 'dir byed pa khyad par can te /

original: phyogs gcig la /🔽aa lam ka ra ne na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la / aa lam ka ra ne na /
translated: In one case,🔽alam-karaṇa

original: kha lu ka ra ne na /
analyzed: kha lu ka ra ne na /
translated: kalu-karaṇa

original: 'dir gsum pas rang bzhin sogs nyid las so /
analyzed: 'dir gsum pas rang bzhin sogs nyid las so /
translated: Here the third case is used for the nature, etc. itself.

original: aa lam dang kh lu dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa lam dang kh lu dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: m'a karshi / dgag pa dag la zhes pa ci zhe na ;
analyzed: m'a karshi / dgag pa dag la zhes pa ci zhe na ;

original: aa lam k'a ra:/
analyzed: aa lam k'a ra:/

original: kha lu k'ar:/ 'dir aa lam dang kha lu'i sgra dang rgyan dang nges pa'i don dag brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kha lu k'ar:/ 'dir aa lam dang kha lu'i sgra dang rgyan dang nges pa'i don dag brjod pa'o //
translated: Here the words ālam and khalu express ornament and certainty.

original: byed pa po gcig dag gi snga ma'i dus la'o //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig dag gi snga ma'i dus la'o //
translated: Of those with one agent, in the past.

original: byed pa po gcig ste ma tshang bar gyur pa'i gong gi don dag la de dag ni byed pa po gcig pa dg go /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig ste ma tshang bar gyur pa'i gong gi don dag la de dag ni byed pa po gcig pa dg go /
translated: Those with one agent, those with incomplete meanings before, they are those with one agent.

original: snga ma yang 'di yin la dus kyang yin pa ni snga ma'i dus so ;
analyzed: snga ma yang 'di yin la dus kyang yin pa ni snga ma'i dus so ;
translated: And past and time is past time.

original: byed pa po gcig dag gi ste gang byed pa po gcig tu mtshungs par gyur pa'i byings gnyis dag gi nang nas snga ma'i dus la bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa'i byings kyidon de la 'jug bzhin pa'i byings las ktv'i rkyen 'gyur ro /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig dag gi ste gang byed pa po gcig tu mtshungs par gyur pa'i byings gnyis dag gi nang nas snga ma'i dus la bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa'i byings kyidon de la 'jug bzhin pa'i byings las ktv'i rkyen 'gyur ro /
translated: Of those with one agent, from among the two roots that have become equivalent in one agent, the suffix ktvā is formed from the root meaning to be accomplished in the past time.

original: sna tva da da ti /
analyzed: sna tva da da ti /
translated: snātāvadhīḥ,

original: bi tva she te /
analyzed: bi tva she te /
translated: vītāśeṣe,

original: byed pa po gcig dag gi zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig dag gi zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: ga ta ba ti ba ti de ba datte bra dza ti ya dznya datta:/
analyzed: ga ta ba ti ba ti de ba datte bra dza ti ya dznya datta:/
translated: gatāvadhīvadhīdeva datte prajñādatte yajñadattaḥ.

original: nishtha zhes pas ga mi la kta bantu'o //
analyzed: nishtha zhes pas ga mi la kta bantu'o //
translated: The affix niṣṭha is added to the root gam.🔽The affix vana is added to the root pa.

original: ba na ti ta no ti sogs zhes pas lnga pa dbyi'o //
analyzed: ba na ti ta no ti sogs zhes pas lnga pa dbyi'o //
translated: The affix tanoti is added to the root pa.

original: snga ma'i dus la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽pa tsa ti tsa /
analyzed: snga ma'i dus la zhes pa ci zhe na / pa tsa ti tsa /
translated: What is the meaning of the word pūrvakāle?🔽The affix pacati is added to the root pac.

original: pa tha ti tsa /
analyzed: pa tha ti tsa /
translated: The affix patati is added to the root pat.

original: pha rol tshu rol sbyor ba la 'ang ngo /
analyzed: pha rol tshu rol sbyor ba la 'ang ngo /
translated: The affix is also added to the combination of pūrva and aparā.

original: pha rol dang tshu rol de dag ni pha rol tshu rol dag go /
analyzed: pha rol dang tshu rol de dag ni pha rol tshu rol dag go /
translated: Pūrva and aparā are pūrva-aparā.

original: de dag sbyor ba ni pha rol tshu rol sbyor ba'o ;
analyzed: de dag sbyor ba ni pha rol tshu rol sbyor ba'o ;
translated: The combination of those is pūrva-aparā-yoga.

original: / pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba gyur pa dang / tshu rol gyi'ang pha rol gyi sbyor bar gyur pa'i byings las kta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba gyur pa dang / tshu rol gyi'ang pha rol gyi sbyor bar gyur pa'i byings las kta'i rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix kta is added to the root when the combination of pūrva and aparā is changed to the combination of aparā and pūrva, and when the combination of aparā and pūrva is changed to the combination of pūrva and aparā.

original: pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba la /🔽aa ti kra mya parba tam na d'i /🔽tshu rol ri bos pha rol chu klung gi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba la / aa ti kra mya parba tam na d'i / tshu rol ri bos pha rol chu klung gi sbyor ba'o //
translated: In the combination of pūrva and aparā,🔽the affix ati is added to the root krama.

original: pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba la /🔽aa pra sya na da parba ta:/🔽pha @304a * //
analyzed: pha rol gyis tshu rol gyi sbyor ba la / aa pra sya na da parba ta:/ pha @304a * //
translated: The combination of pūrva and aparā is changed to the combination of aparā and nadī.🔽In the combination of aparā and pūrva,🔽the affix aprasya is added to the root parvata.

original: rol chu bos tshu rol ri bo'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rol chu bos tshu rol ri bo'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The combination of aparā and nadī is changed to the combination of pūrva and parvata.

original: a'a pli khyab pa la'o //
analyzed: a'a pli khyab pa la'o //
translated: The affix āpli is added to the root vyāpti.

original: nanya sngon du'o //🔽yang yang la nam\ yang na ste tshig gnyis dag kyang ngo /
analyzed: nanya sngon du'o // yang yang la nam\ yang na ste tshig gnyis dag kyang ngo /
translated: The first is nna.🔽The second is nna or na.

original: lan gnyis brjod pa ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lan gnyis brjod pa ni gnyis so //
translated: The second is a repetition of the two words.

original: byed pa po gcig pa dag gi byings don gnyis dag gi nang nas dus snga ma la bsgrub par bya ba'i byings don la /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig pa dag gi byings don gnyis dag gi nang nas dus snga ma la bsgrub par bya ba'i byings don la /
translated: From among the two meanings of the verbal roots of those having the same agent, the verbal root meaning that is to be established in the past

original: yang yang gi khyad par la 'jug bzhin pa'i byings las ktv'i rkyen 'gyur zhing nam\ gyi rkyen 'ang ngo //
analyzed: yang yang gi khyad par la 'jug bzhin pa'i byings las ktv'i rkyen 'gyur zhing nam\ gyi rkyen 'ang ngo //
translated: is formed by the ktvā affix while the verbal root meaning that is to be established in the present is formed by the na affix.

original: ktva dang nama'i mtha' can yang tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro /🔽bhu ktva bhu ktva bra dza ti /
analyzed: ktva dang nama'i mtha' can yang tshig gnyis su 'gyur ro / bhu ktva bhu ktva bra dza ti /
translated: Those that end in ktvā and na are also two words.🔽Bhuktvā, bhuktvā, bhraṣṭi.

original: bham dzam bho dzam bra dza ti /🔽pr'i tva s'i ta she tre /
analyzed: bham dzam bho dzam bra dza ti / pr'i tva s'i ta she tre /
translated: Bhamja, bhamja, bhraṣṭi.🔽Prītvā, sīt, śetrī.

original: p'a yam pra yam she te /
analyzed: p'a yam pra yam she te /
translated: Pāyām, prayām, śete.

original: yang yang la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang yang la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the second is nna?

original: p'i tv'a a'a y'a ti //
analyzed: p'i tv'a a'a y'a ti //
translated: Pītvā, āyāti.

original: 'o na ktva dang nama'i mtha' can gyi sgra dag gnyis brjod pa med pa las /
analyzed: 'o na ktva dang nama'i mtha' can gyi sgra dag gnyis brjod pa med pa las /
translated: Now, from the words that end in ktvā and na,

original: yang yang la so sor rtogs par nus pa me do zhes pa'i shugs las yang yang la de'i gnyis brjod pa grub po zhes pas tshig gnyis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di ci zhe na /🔽de ltar na ji ltar mthong ba bzhin gzhan la yang tshig gnyis brjod pa'i don du tshig nyis kyang zhes pa 'di'o//
analyzed: yang yang la so sor rtogs par nus pa me do zhes pa'i shugs las yang yang la de'i gnyis brjod pa grub po zhes pas tshig gnyis kyang ngo zhes pa 'di ci zhe na / de ltar na ji ltar mthong ba bzhin gzhan la yang tshig gnyis brjod pa'i don du tshig nyis kyang zhes pa 'di'o//
translated: What is the purpose of the two words?🔽The purpose is to state to others what one has seen.🔽Therefore, the two words are used to indicate the pervasion.

original: des na khyab par 'dod pa la tshig gnyis kyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na khyab par 'dod pa la tshig gnyis kyis 'gyur te /
translated: The two words are used in the following:

original: gra mo gra mor ma n'i ya:/
analyzed: gra mo gra mor ma n'i ya:/
translated: “grāmaṃ grāmam anuprāpsyasi”🔽“upapari adhi ca adhi ca”

original: au pa ri aa dhi dang aa dhas zhes pa 'di rnams nye ba las te /
analyzed: au pa ri aa dhi dang aa dhas zhes pa 'di rnams nye ba las te /
translated: These are from the Upapurāṇa.

original: au parya sa ri gra mam /🔽aa dhya dhi gr'a mam /
analyzed: au parya sa ri gra mam / aa dhya dhi gr'a mam /
translated: “Uparisaṃ grāmam”🔽“adhyadhigṛhṇām”

original: aardo rdo gra mam /
analyzed: aardo rdo gra mam /
translated: “arddorddhagṛhṇām”

original: au pa ri la sogs pa rnams la tshig la gnyis byas pa na gnyis pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: au pa ri la sogs pa rnams la tshig la gnyis byas pa na gnyis pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: In upaparī, etc., the second word is to be explained.

original: au pa ri sha ri so gha ta dham ra ya ti /
analyzed: au pa ri sha ri so gha ta dham ra ya ti /
translated: “Upaparī śarī soghadhaṃ ra yati”

original: zhes pa 'dir ni gnyis kyi dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dir ni gnyis kyi dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this case, the second word is not used.

original: nye ba'i brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not desired to be expressed.

original: pa ri 'dor ba la gnyis kyi dngos por yang na 'gyur te tshig sdud med pa la'o //🔽si ra si ra tri garte bhyo brishta:/
analyzed: pa ri 'dor ba la gnyis kyi dngos por yang na 'gyur te tshig sdud med pa la'o // si ra si ra tri garte bhyo brishta:/
translated: In the dropping of the near, there is a dual form, in the absence of a compound.🔽Sirasiratrigarthebhyoshta.

original: pra ri tri garte bhyo brishta:/
analyzed: pra ri tri garte bhyo brishta:/
translated: Pritiratrigarthebhyo 'shta.

original: tshig sdud med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽sa ri ti garta brishta:/
analyzed: tshig sdud med pa la zhes pa ci zhe na / sa ri ti garta brishta:/
translated: What is meant by 'in the absence of a compound'?🔽Saritrigartashta.🔽Pritiratrigarthebhya.

original: pri ra tri garte bhya:/🔽pa ri tri garta /
analyzed: pri ra tri garte bhya:/ pa ri tri garta /
translated: Paritrigart.

original: zhes pa mi zad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mi zad par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus it becomes inexhaustible.

original: de ltar gzhan la yang sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas gnyis kyi dngos po shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas gnyis kyi dngos po shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by following the application to others, the dual form should be understood.

original: las la krinya las khros tshig la kha munya'o //
analyzed: las la krinya las khros tshig la kha munya'o //
translated: In the case of krinya, it is angry speech. In the case of khamnya, it is angry speech.

original: las ny ba'i tshig la kriny las smos pa rtogs par bya bzhin pa la kha muny 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las ny ba'i tshig la kriny las smos pa rtogs par bya bzhin pa la kha muny 'gyur ro //
translated: The mention of krinya in the case of knavya should be understood as khamnya in the case of knavya.

original: tsoo ram k'ar ma kro sha ti /
analyzed: tsoo ram k'ar ma kro sha ti /
translated: Caurmakarmakroshati.

original: bri sha la k'a ra m'a kro sha ti /
analyzed: bri sha la k'a ra m'a kro sha ti /
translated: Brishalakakaromashati.

original: thung ba dang aa tusha dag gi zhes pas la a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: thung ba dang aa tusha dag gi zhes pas la a'a ga ma'o //
translated: By 'short and atush', it is lagam.

original: byings rnams du ma can gyi nyid kyi phyir 'dir ka ro ti brjod pa la 'jug ste /🔽des na / tsoo ro si bri sha la bi /
analyzed: byings rnams du ma can gyi nyid kyi phyir 'dir ka ro ti brjod pa la 'jug ste / des na / tsoo ro si bri sha la bi /
translated: The root is used here in the sense of “many” because it is said to be karota.🔽Thus, it is said that one reviles by saying “cōrōsi brisha lāvi.”

original: zhes pa de lta bu brjod pas smod par byed do zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: zhes pa de lta bu brjod pas smod par byed do zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that one reviles.

original: ro myang ba la yang ngo /
analyzed: ro myang ba la yang ngo /
translated: It is also in the sense of “enjoying.”

original: ro myang @304b ba la zhes pa 'dir ro myang ba'i sgra'i don gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro myang @304b ba la zhes pa 'dir ro myang ba'i sgra'i don gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the term “enjoying” is to be taken.

original: ro myang ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la kri nya las khamunya 'gyur ro //🔽sva dum k'a ram bhukte /
analyzed: ro myang ba'i don nye ba'i tshig la kri nya las khamunya 'gyur ro // sva dum k'a ram bhukte /
translated: In the case of the term “enjoying,” the kṛt suffix is changed to kṛt.🔽svādūkaraṃ bhuṅkte

original: la bang tsam k'a ram bhum kte /
analyzed: la bang tsam k'a ram bhum kte /
translated: laṅgūlakaram bhuṅkte

original: yang na zhes pa 'phen te des na /
analyzed: yang na zhes pa 'phen te des na /
translated: Or, it is said,

original: sv'a du kri tva bhum kte /
analyzed: sv'a du kri tva bhum kte /
translated: svādūkṛtaṃ bhuṅkte

original: tsi'i yul dang bud med kyi yul la'ang kha munya mi 'dod de /
analyzed: tsi'i yul dang bud med kyi yul la'ang kha munya mi 'dod de /
translated: ci is not desired in the sense of “country” or “woman.”

original: sta d'a kri tv'a sa yo bhumkte /
analyzed: sta d'a kri tv'a sa yo bhumkte /
translated: stādūkṛtā sa yo bhuṅkte

original: sv'a dv'i kri tva ya b'a gu bhamkte /
analyzed: sv'a dv'i kri tva ya b'a gu bhamkte /
translated: svādūkṛtaṃ yavāgu bhuṅkte

original: tsvi pha rol la tsi la yang ngo zhes pa'i 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las thung ngu'i ring po'o //
analyzed: tsvi pha rol la tsi la yang ngo zhes pa'i 'jig rten gyi nye bar spyod pa las thung ngu'i ring po'o //
translated: ci is also in the sense of “other.” Thus, the long is from the short in worldly usage.

original: a'i rkyen yang ste aut mtha' las yon tan brjod pa las zhes pa 'dis so //
analyzed: a'i rkyen yang ste aut mtha' las yon tan brjod pa las zhes pa 'dis so //
translated: The condition of the vowel a is also, that is, from the description of the qualities from the end of the Uṇādis.

original: aa na+ya tha dad ae bam dang ka tham dang aittham rnams nye ba'i tshig la krinya las khya munya bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: aa na+ya tha dad ae bam dang ka tham dang aittham rnams nye ba'i tshig la krinya las khya munya bshad par bya ste /
translated: The words anya, evaṃ, katham, and ittham are explained as khyā, muṇya, and kṛtya in the vicinity.

original: gal te ka ro ti don med pa can gyi sbyor ba yin par gyur pa la'o //🔽aa n+ya th'a k'a ram bhumkte /
analyzed: gal te ka ro ti don med pa can gyi sbyor ba yin par gyur pa la'o // aa n+ya th'a k'a ram bhumkte /
translated: If it were the application of the meaningless karoti.🔽anya-kārambhukte

original: ae ba k'a ram bhukte /🔽ka tham k'a ram bhukte /
analyzed: ae ba k'a ram bhukte / ka tham k'a ram bhukte /
translated: evaṃ-kārambhukte🔽katham-kārambhukte

original: aittha k'a ram bhumkte:/
analyzed: aittha k'a ram bhumkte:/
translated: ittham-kārambhukte

original: 'dir thams cad du ka ro ti 'bras bu med pa'i sbyor ba'o /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad du ka ro ti 'bras bu med pa'i sbyor ba'o /
translated: Here, in all cases, karoti is the application of the meaningless.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i don gang yin pa'i de rtogs par bay ba la de yod pa ma yin yang shes par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i don gang yin pa'i de rtogs par bay ba la de yod pa ma yin yang shes par bya ba nyid do //
translated: What is the meaning of that? That is to be understood, even though it does not exist, it is to be known.

original: don med pa can gyi sbyor ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: don med pa can gyi sbyor ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the application of the meaningless?

original: aa na+ya th'a kri tva shi ro bhukte /
analyzed: aa na+ya th'a kri tva shi ro bhukte /
translated: anya-kṛta-śiro-bhukte

original: 'dir don dang bcas pa'i ka ro ti'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir don dang bcas pa'i ka ro ti'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, the application of karoti is meaningful.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni ka ro ti la go'i za ba bya ba la las nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni ka ro ti la go'i za ba bya ba la las nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the non-existent, the suffix kṛt becomes karoti, to eat.

original: mtha' dag dri sha las nama'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag dri sha las nama'o //
translated: The suffix nma is added to the suffix kṛt when it has the meaning of all.

original: las la zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: las la zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: The suffix kṛt is added to the root.

original: mtha' dag gi khyad par can gyi las nye ba'i tshig la drisha las nam gyi rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag gi khyad par can gyi las nye ba'i tshig la drisha las nam gyi rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The suffix nma is added to the upasarga-s that have the meaning of all.

original: ka n+ya darsham bar ya ti /
analyzed: ka n+ya darsham bar ya ti /
translated: Kaṇyādarśayati.

original: bu mo gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de gdams par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bu mo gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de gdams par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “She instructs whatever girl she sees.”

original: bi di las kyang mtha' dag la nam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bi di las kyang mtha' dag la nam bshad par bya ste /
translated: The suffix nma is also explained as having the meaning of all.

original: brahma na be dam bho dza ya ti /
analyzed: brahma na be dam bho dza ya ti /
translated: Brahmaṇo vidma bhojayati.

original: bram ze dag dang gang shes par byed pa'am thob pa 'ang rnams par dpyod par byed pa de dang de thams cad longs spyod par byed do zhes pa'i don do //
analyzed: bram ze dag dang gang shes par byed pa'am thob pa 'ang rnams par dpyod par byed pa de dang de thams cad longs spyod par byed do zhes pa'i don do //
translated: The meaning is: “He enjoys whatever he knows or obtains from the brahmins.”

original: yod pa'i don can gyi bi di gzung bar mi bya ste las ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i don can gyi bi di gzung bar mi bya ste las ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The suffix vid is not to be taken as having the meaning of existence because it is not a kṛt suffix.

original: y'a bat la binda dzvi ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: y'a bat la binda dzvi ba dag gi'o //
translated: The suffix nma is added to the upasarga-s yā and vi.

original: binda ti las mutsa sogs nyid las yig a'a ga ma byas pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i binda zhes pa rjes su mthun par byas so ;
analyzed: binda ti las mutsa sogs nyid las yig a'a ga ma byas pa'i phyogs gcig pa'i binda zhes pa rjes su mthun par byas so ;
translated: The word bindu is formed from the root muci with the affix aṇ, and the affix ṭi. The bindu is made to conform to the side of the single vowel a.

original: / ya bat kyi sgra nye ba'i tshig la bidli thob pa la'o zhes pa di las dang dz'i ba las kyang na ma 'gyur ro //🔽y'a bat be dam bhukte /
analyzed: / ya bat kyi sgra nye ba'i tshig la bidli thob pa la'o zhes pa di las dang dz'i ba las kyang na ma 'gyur ro // y'a bat be dam bhukte /
translated: The word yāvat is a near-synonym for vidhi, meaning “to obtain.” The na is not changed from the da of the root.🔽Yāvat means “to enjoy.”

original: y'a bat dzi bam satka ram s'u dza ya mi /🔽tsarma au da ra dag la su'i ri'i 'o //
analyzed: y'a bat dzi bam satka ram s'u dza ya mi / tsarma au da ra dag la su'i ri'i 'o //
translated: Yāvat means “to do a favor.”🔽The word yāvat is a near-synonym for carma and udara, meaning “to the edge.”

original: tsarma dang au dar dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la su ri ain mtha' can las nam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsarma dang au dar dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la su ri ain mtha' can las nam 'gyur ro //
translated: The na is changed from the i of the root.

original: tsarma @305a * //
analyzed: tsarma @305a * //
translated: Carma means “skin.”

original: pu ramstri n'a ti /
analyzed: pu ramstri n'a ti /
translated: Pūrṇas tṛṇāniti.

original: au da ra su ram bhum kte /
analyzed: au da ra su ram bhum kte /
translated: Udara means “to enjoy.”

original: pu ri la rgyu'i don la zhes pas ain mtha'o //
analyzed: pu ri la rgyu'i don la zhes pas ain mtha'o //
translated: Pūrṇa means “to the cause.” The i is changed to i.

original: char pa'i tshad la ste au dbyi ba'ang yang na'o //
analyzed: char pa'i tshad la ste au dbyi ba'ang yang na'o //
translated: It is the measure of rain. Udva is also again.

original: las nye ba'i tshig la pu ri las char pa'i tshad rtogs par bya bzhin pa la nam 'gyur te /
analyzed: las nye ba'i tshig la pu ri las char pa'i tshad rtogs par bya bzhin pa la nam 'gyur te /
translated: The word pūrṇa is a near-synonym for carma. The measure of rain is understood to be the end of the action.

original: de'i yang yang na au dbyi'o //
analyzed: de'i yang yang na au dbyi'o //
translated: The i is changed to i.

original: goshtha pu ram brishto dab:/
analyzed: goshtha pu ram brishto dab:/
translated: gostha-puram brishtôdb

original: goshpad pra ma brishto de ba:/🔽gos don la kno bi las so //
analyzed: goshpad pra ma brishto de ba:/ gos don la kno bi las so //
translated: gos-pad-pramam brishtôdb🔽gos-dona-la-knu-vilsa

original: gang gi don gos yin pa de gos kyi don no //
analyzed: gang gi don gos yin pa de gos kyi don no //
translated: That which is the meaning of gos is the meaning of gos.

original: gos kyi don la las nye ba'i tshig la knu yi sgra la'o zhes pa ain mtha' can 'di la nam\ 'gyur te /
analyzed: gos kyi don la las nye ba'i tshig la knu yi sgra la'o zhes pa ain mtha' can 'di la nam\ 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of the word knu in the near-word gos-dona, the suffix -i is added.

original: gal te char kyi tshad rtogs par 'gyur na'o //🔽tsa lakno pam brishta:/
analyzed: gal te char kyi tshad rtogs par 'gyur na'o // tsa lakno pam brishta:/
translated: If the measure of rain were understood.🔽cala-knu-pam brisht

original: bastra kno pam brishta:/
analyzed: bastra kno pam brishta:/
translated: bstara-knu-pam brisht

original: aarti hr'i tsl'i r'i knu yi zhes pa 'dis knu yi'i ain pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aarti hr'i tsl'i r'i knu yi zhes pa 'dis knu yi'i ain pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: arti-hrii-tsali-rii-knu-yi. By this, the -i of knu-yi becomes -ipa, and the -a of the following word is elided.

original: ya yig dbyi ba dang yon tan yang go /🔽g'a tra dang pu ru sha dag la sna las so //
analyzed: ya yig dbyi ba dang yon tan yang go / g'a tra dang pu ru sha dag la sna las so //
translated: The -ya of the following word is elided, and the quality is understood.🔽In the case of gatra and purusha, the suffix -na is added.

original: g'a tra dang pu ru sha dag la las nye ba'i tshig lashna gtsang ba la'o zhes pa 'di las nam 'gyur te /
analyzed: g'a tra dang pu ru sha dag la las nye ba'i tshig lashna gtsang ba la'o zhes pa 'di las nam 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of gatra and purusha, the suffix -na is added to the near-word.

original: gal te char pa'i tshad gyur pa na'o //🔽g'a tra sna yam brishta :/
analyzed: gal te char pa'i tshad gyur pa na'o // g'a tra sna yam brishta :/
translated: If the measure of rain were understood.🔽gatra-snan-yam brisht

original: pu ru sha sna yam brishto da ba:/
analyzed: pu ru sha sna yam brishto da ba:/
translated: purusha-snan-yam brisht

original: ni m'u la sa m'u la dag la ka sha las so /
analyzed: ni m'u la sa m'u la dag la ka sha las so /
translated: The affix kaś is added to ni-mūla and sa-mūla.

original: ni m'u la dang sa m'u dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la ka sha las nam gyi rkyen 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ni m'u la dang sa m'u dag gi las nye ba'i tshig la ka sha las nam gyi rkyen 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix kaś is added to the words ni-mūla and sa-mūla.

original: ni m'u la ka sha ti zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ni m'u la ka sha ti zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ni-mūla-kaś-ati.

original: sa m'u la k'a sham ka sha ti /🔽shushka tsurna ruksham rnams la bisha las so //
analyzed: sa m'u la k'a sham ka sha ti / shushka tsurna ruksham rnams la bisha las so //
translated: sa-mūla-kaś-am-kaś-ati.🔽The affix viś is added to śuṣka, cuṇṇa, and ruksa.

original: shushka dang tsurna dang ruksha rnams la las nye ba'i tshig la bi shi las nam 'gyur ro /
analyzed: shushka dang tsurna dang ruksha rnams la las nye ba'i tshig la bi shi las nam 'gyur ro /
translated: The affix viś is added to the words śuṣka, cuṇṇa, and ruksa.

original: shushka pe sham se nashti:/
analyzed: shushka pe sham se nashti:/
translated: The meaning is: śuṣka-viś-am-se-na-ti.🔽cuṇṇa-viś-am-si-na-ti.

original: ts'urna pesham sinashti:/ rukshape sham sinashti:/
analyzed: ts'urna pesham sinashti:/ rukshape sham sinashti:/
translated: ruksa-viś-am-si-na-ti.

original: dz'i ba la gra ha las so //
analyzed: dz'i ba la gra ha las so //
translated: The affix graha is added to jīva.

original: dz'i ba'i las nye ba'i tshig la gra ha las nam\ 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dz'i ba'i las nye ba'i tshig la gra ha las nam\ 'gyur ro //
translated: The affix graha is added to the word jīva.

original: dz'i ba gra ham grihna ti /
analyzed: dz'i ba gra ham grihna ti /
translated: The meaning is: jīva-graha-grah-ati.

original: aa krit dang sa m'ul dag la krinya dang hanti las so /
analyzed: aa krit dang sa m'ul dag la krinya dang hanti las so /
translated: The affixes kṛtya and hanti are added to akṛta and sa-mūla.

original: aakrit dang sa m'ul dag nye ba'i tshi la krinya dang hanti dag las nam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: aakrit dang sa m'ul dag nye ba'i tshi la krinya dang hanti dag las nam bshad par bya ste /
translated: The affixes kṛtya and hanti are added to the words akṛta and sa-mūla.

original: aa krita ka ram ka ro ti /
analyzed: aa krita ka ram ka ro ti /
translated: The meaning is: akṛta-kara- karoti.

original: sam'u la gh'a tam hanti /🔽byed pa la hanti las so //
analyzed: sam'u la gh'a tam hanti / byed pa la hanti las so //
translated: samulghāṭam hantaḥ.🔽In the sense of an instrument, hantaḥ is added to the root.

original: byed pa la nye ba'i tshig la hanti las nam 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa la nye ba'i tshig la hanti las nam 'gyur /
translated: In the sense of an instrument, hantaḥ is added to the root.

original: p'a ni gh'a tam bh'u mim hanti /
analyzed: p'a ni gh'a tam bh'u mim hanti /
translated: pāṇibhyāṃ bhūmiṃ hantaḥ.

original: lag pa dag gis sa gzhi la bsnun to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lag pa dag gis sa gzhi la bsnun to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: He struck the ground with his hands.

original: 'tshe ba'i don las las gcig pa can las kyang zhes pas grub pa la brjod pa ni mi tshe ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i don las las gcig pa can las kyang zhes pas grub pa la brjod pa ni mi tshe ba'i don du'o //
translated: From the meaning of injury, also from the one that is the same as the action, it is said in the formation: For the meaning of not living.

original: gsher ba la bisha las so /
analyzed: gsher ba la bisha las so /
translated: In the sense of moistening, from viś.

original: gang gi snum par byed pa de ni gsher ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi snum par byed pa de ni gsher ba'o //
translated: That which moistens is the moistener.

original: byed pa la zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: byed pa la zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: In the sense of an instrument, as before.

original: gsher ba brjod pa'i byed pa nye ba'i tshig la pisha las nam\ 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsher ba brjod pa'i byed pa nye ba'i tshig la pisha las nam\ 'gyur ro //
translated: In the sense of an instrument, piś is added to the root in the expression of moistening.

original: tee la pesham si nashti:/
analyzed: tee la pesham si nashti:/
translated: telaiḥ piśaṃ siñcati.

original: til mar gyis snum par bye do zhes pa'i @305b don to ;
analyzed: til mar gyis snum par bye do zhes pa'i @305b don to ;
translated: The meaning is: He moistens with sesame oil.

original: / de bzhin du /🔽ghri ta pe sham si nashti:/
analyzed: / de bzhin du / ghri ta pe sham si nashti:/
translated: In the same way,🔽ghṛtaiḥ piśaṃ siñcati.

original: lag pa'i don la graha barti bri ta rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i don la graha barti bri ta rnams kyi'o //
translated: In the sense of hand, the roots grh, bṛt, and dr are added.

original: gang gi don lag pa yin pa de ni lag pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi don lag pa yin pa de ni lag pa'i don to //
translated: That which has the meaning of hand is the sense of hand.

original: lag pa'i don gyi byed pa nye ba'i tshig la grahi dang pri ti ain gyi mtha' las dang 'ba' zhig pa las kyang nam 'gyur ro //🔽hasta gra ham grihn'a ti /
analyzed: lag pa'i don gyi byed pa nye ba'i tshig la grahi dang pri ti ain gyi mtha' las dang 'ba' zhig pa las kyang nam 'gyur ro // hasta gra ham grihn'a ti /
translated: The affix of the meaning of the hand is the near affix. It is also from the end of graha and prīti, and from the indeclinable.🔽grahaṃ gṛhṇāti

original: ka ra gra ham grihn'a ti ;
analyzed: ka ra gra ham grihn'a ti ;
translated: karaṃ gṛhṇāti

original: p'a ni gram ha grihna ti /
analyzed: p'a ni gram ha grihna ti /
translated: pāṇiṃ gṛhṇāti

original: hasta barttam bartta ya ti /
analyzed: hasta barttam bartta ya ti /
translated: hastaṃ varttayati

original: p'a ni bartam ka ra barttam /
analyzed: p'a ni bartam ka ra barttam /
translated: pāṇiṃ kartavyaṃ varttayati

original: hasta barttam bartta te /
analyzed: hasta barttam bartta te /
translated: hastaṃ varttayate

original: p'a ni barttam /
analyzed: p'a ni barttam /
translated: pāṇiṃ varttayati

original: bri ti las a'a nersha klag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bri ti las a'a nersha klag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: From bṛtti, ṇerśa is added.

original: rang gi don la busha yi'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la busha yi'o //
translated: For one's own purpose, there is puṣya.

original: rang gi don ni rang don no //🔽rang gi don rjod par byed pa nye ba'i tshig la pu sha las nam 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rang gi don ni rang don no // rang gi don rjod par byed pa nye ba'i tshig la pu sha las nam 'gyur ro /
translated: One's own purpose is one's own purpose.🔽For expressing one's own purpose, the near affix is from puṣya.

original: sva po sham pu sha ti ;🔽go pa sham /
analyzed: sva po sham pu sha ti ; go pa sham /
translated: svapūṣaṃ puṣyāti🔽gopūṣam

original: pi tri po sha /
analyzed: pi tri po sha /
translated: pitrapūṣam

original: ree po sham /🔽gzhi la bandha'i 'o //
analyzed: ree po sham / gzhi la bandha'i 'o //
translated: rāyaspūṣam🔽For the basis, there is bandha.

original: gzhi nye ba'i tshig la bandha zhes pa'i byings 'di las nam 'gyur ro /🔽tsa kra bandham hna ti /
analyzed: gzhi nye ba'i tshig la bandha zhes pa'i byings 'di las nam 'gyur ro / tsa kra bandham hna ti /
translated: For the near affix of the basis, this is from the root bandha.🔽cakrabandham hantaḥ

original: tsa kre ba dha ti /
analyzed: tsa kre ba dha ti /
translated: cakrabandhat

original: 'khor lo 'ching ngo zhes pa'i don to //🔽dz'i ba pu ru sha dag la byed pa po dag la na shi ba hi dag las so //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'ching ngo zhes pa'i don to // dz'i ba pu ru sha dag la byed pa po dag la na shi ba hi dag las so //
translated: The meaning is: “The wheel is bound.”🔽The words jīva and puruṣa are used for the agent.

original: dz'i ba dang pu ru sha dag byed la'o ;
analyzed: dz'i ba dang pu ru sha dag byed la'o ;
translated: The words jīva and puruṣa are for the agent.

original: brjod pa nye ba'i tshig la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du na shi dang po ba hi dag las nam 'gyur ro //🔽dz'i ba n'a sham na shya te /
analyzed: brjod pa nye ba'i tshig la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du na shi dang po ba hi dag las nam 'gyur ro // dz'i ba n'a sham na shya te /
translated: The words naśi and pūrvāhni are used in accordance with the number of the noun.

original: 'tsho bzad do zhes pa'i don to //🔽pu ru sha ba ham ba ha ti /
analyzed: 'tsho bzad do zhes pa'i don to // pu ru sha ba ham ba ha ti /
translated: Jīvanāśa means “the life is destroyed.”🔽The meaning is: “The life is exhausted.”🔽Puruṣa-vahati means “the man obtains.”

original: skyes bu thob par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu thob par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “The man obtains.”

original: byed pa po dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po dag la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “for the agent”?

original: dz'i be na nashta:/
analyzed: dz'i be na nashta:/
translated: Jīvanāśa means “the life is destroyed.”

original: pu ru she na a'udha:/
analyzed: pu ru she na a'udha:/
translated: Puruṣa-uddhā means “the man is lifted up.”

original: ba ha las kta'i rkyen no ;
analyzed: ba ha las kta'i rkyen no ;
translated: The suffix kta is added.

original: sva pi pa tsi zhes pas sam pra s'a ra na'o //🔽ha'i dha'o zhes sogs kyi dha nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sva pi pa tsi zhes pas sam pra s'a ra na'o // ha'i dha'o zhes sogs kyi dha nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word svapac means “he cooks himself” or “he cooks well.”🔽The word hīḍhā means “there” and so on.

original: aurdha la shu shi p'u ra dag gi'o /
analyzed: aurdha la shu shi p'u ra dag gi'o /
translated: The words urdhva and śiṣṭa are used for “above.”

original: byed po smos pa rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: byed po smos pa rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The word puruṣa is used for “the agent.”🔽The word puruṣa is used for “the agent.”

original: a'urdha'i sgra byed pa po nye ba'i tshig la shu shi dang p'u ra dag las nam 'gyur ro /
analyzed: a'urdha'i sgra byed pa po nye ba'i tshig la shu shi dang p'u ra dag las nam 'gyur ro /
translated: The word ūrddhi is a derivative of the root śuśi, to dry, and pūrya, to fill, with the prefix upa.

original: aurddha sho sham shu shya ti /
analyzed: aurddha sho sham shu shya ti /
translated: Ūrdhvaśoṣaṇaṃ śuśyati.

original: steng skams zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: steng skams zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: It means “drying up above.”

original: / au rddha b'u ram p'urya te /
analyzed: / au rddha b'u ram p'urya te /
translated: Ūrdhvaṃ pūryate pūrya.

original: steng du gang ngo zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: steng du gang ngo zhes pa'i don to /
translated: It means “filling up above.”

original: byed pa po la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽aurdhhe na shushya ti /
analyzed: byed pa po la zhes pa ci zhe na / aurdhhe na shushya ti /
translated: What is the meaning of “with respect to the agent”?🔽Ūrdhvaṃ śuśyati ūrdhvaheṇa.

original: aurdhhe na p'urya te /
analyzed: aurdhhe na p'urya te /
translated: Ūrdhvaṃ pūryate ūrdhvaheṇa.

original: las la'ang nye bar 'jal ba la'o /
analyzed: las la'ang nye bar 'jal ba la'o /
translated: It is also applied to the object of the action.

original: byed pa po brjod pa nye bar 'jal ba nye ba'i tshig la las la'ang byings las nam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po brjod pa nye bar 'jal ba nye ba'i tshig la las la'ang byings las nam 'gyur ro //
translated: The derivative of the root with the prefix is applied to the object of the action, with respect to the agent.

original: aa dza ka n'a sham nashta:/
analyzed: aa dza ka n'a sham nashta:/
translated: Ajakānāśaṃ naṣṭaḥ.

original: aa dza ka bzhin du nyams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aa dza ka bzhin du nyams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means “lost like a goat.”

original: las la // ratna ni dh'a yam ni hi ta:/
analyzed: las la // ratna ni dh'a yam ni hi ta:/
translated: With respect to the object of the action.🔽Ratnaṃ nidhāyaṃ nihitaṃ.

original: rin po che bzhin du sbas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rin po che bzhin du sbas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means “hidden like a jewel.”

original: du dha nya 'dzin /
analyzed: du dha nya 'dzin /
translated: Dugdham ādadhānaḥ.

original: ni sngon du'o //
analyzed: ni sngon du'o //
translated: It is prior.

original: nye bar 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽aa dza ko nashta:/
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba la zhes pa ci zhe na / aa dza ko nashta:/
translated: What is the meaning of “with respect to the object of the action”?

original: ghri tam ni hi tam /
analyzed: ghri tam ni hi tam /
translated: Ajakānāśaṃ gṛhṇan nihitaṃ.

original: da dh'a ti'i hi'o zhes pas dhanya'i hir bsgyur ro //
analyzed: da dh'a ti'i hi'o zhes pas dhanya'i hir bsgyur ro //
translated: By dadhāti hi, dhanih is formed.

original: ka sha la sogs @306a * //
analyzed: ka sha la sogs @306a * //
translated: The kaś-

original: pa rnams la de rnams nyid kyi rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: pa rnams la de rnams nyid kyi rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: and so on are the suffixes of those.

original: ni m'u la sa m'u la da la ka sha las so zhes pa 'di nas brtsams pa'i byings gang yin pa de rnams ka sha sogs rnams so //
analyzed: ni m'u la sa m'u la da la ka sha las so zhes pa 'di nas brtsams pa'i byings gang yin pa de rnams ka sha sogs rnams so //
translated: The kaś- and so on are those roots that begin with ni-mūla-samūla-dalakaśa.

original: de rnams la rjes su sbyor ba ni phyi nas sbyor ba ka sha sogs de rnams kho nas 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de rnams la rjes su sbyor ba ni phyi nas sbyor ba ka sha sogs de rnams kho nas 'gyur ro /
translated: The suffixes are the subsequent additions of just those kaś- and so on.

original: snga ma nyid dper brjod do //
analyzed: snga ma nyid dper brjod do //
translated: The previous one is the example.

original: nam gyi mtha'i sgra'i don gsal bar byed pa'i don du rjes su sbyor ba gdon mi za bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam gyi mtha'i sgra'i don gsal bar byed pa'i don du rjes su sbyor ba gdon mi za bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the final word of the verse is clarified by the suffix, which must be added without doubt.

original: ka sha la sogs pa rnams kho nas bya ba yod pa'i bya ba des don mtshungs pa'i byings gzhan rnams kyi zhes pa'i don du 'di'o //
analyzed: ka sha la sogs pa rnams kho nas bya ba yod pa'i bya ba des don mtshungs pa'i byings gzhan rnams kyi zhes pa'i don du 'di'o //
translated: The kaś- and so on are the other roots that have the same meaning as the one that has the suffix.

original: des na / ni m'u kra sham hi nasti /
analyzed: des na / ni m'u kra sham hi nasti /
translated: By that,🔽ni-mūla-samūla-dalakaśa-hiṃstis.

original: zhes pa la ka shi las don mtshungs pa'i hi si rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la ka shi las don mtshungs pa'i hi si rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: From kaś-, the hiṃstis with the same meaning is added.

original: gsum pa la au pa dam shi'i'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la au pa dam shi'i'o //
translated: In the third, upadamshi.

original: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig la au pa sngon ma can gyi dam shi las nam\ 'gyur ro //🔽m'u la ke no pa dam sham bhum kte /
analyzed: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig la au pa sngon ma can gyi dam shi las nam\ 'gyur ro // m'u la ke no pa dam sham bhum kte /
translated: In the third, the suffix of proximity, upadamshi, becomes nam.🔽Mulakenopa-damshambhumkte.

original: m'u la ko pa dam sham bhumkte /
analyzed: m'u la ko pa dam sham bhumkte /
translated: Mulakopa-damshambhumkte.

original: gsum pa sogs rnams kyi yang na'o zhes pas phyogs gcig la nye ba'i tshig gi bsdu ba'o /
analyzed: gsum pa sogs rnams kyi yang na'o zhes pas phyogs gcig la nye ba'i tshig gi bsdu ba'o /
translated: The third, etc., also have na. Thus, the compound of proximity is in one part.

original: yang na zhes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes pa 'jug ste /
translated: Or, also is used.

original: des na / m'u la ka no pa dam shya bhukte /
analyzed: des na / m'u la ka no pa dam shya bhukte /
translated: Thus, it is: Mulakanopadamshi-bhumkte.

original: 'tshe ba'i don las kyang las gcig pa can las so //
analyzed: 'tshe ba'i don las kyang las gcig pa can las so //
translated: From the meaning of injury, from the same action.

original: tshig gnyi ga yang 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyi ga yang 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: Both words are in the plural.

original: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig la 'tshe ba'i don can gyi byings las rjes su sbyor bzhin pa'i byings kyi las gcig pa can las nam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig la 'tshe ba'i don can gyi byings las rjes su sbyor bzhin pa'i byings kyi las gcig pa can las nam 'gyur ro //
translated: In the third, the suffix of proximity, from the root with the meaning of injury, the same action of the root that is being added becomes nam.

original: dando pa gh'a tam ga:/
analyzed: dando pa gh'a tam ga:/
translated: Dandophaghatamgaḥ.

original: k'a la ya ti /
analyzed: k'a la ya ti /
translated: Kalayatī.

original: 'dir bsnun pa'i dang bgrang ba'i tshig kyang ba lang rnams su las gcig pa can no /
analyzed: 'dir bsnun pa'i dang bgrang ba'i tshig kyang ba lang rnams su las gcig pa can no /
translated: Here, the words of injury and counting are the same action as the cows.

original: dbyug pas nye bar bsnun cing skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dbyug pas nye bar bsnun cing skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: The stick is used to strike and to point out faults.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: danda t'a da ma hi sh'i ga ma ya ti /
analyzed: danda t'a da ma hi sh'i ga ma ya ti /
translated: danḍena nâhaṃ mahiṣī gamanayati,

original: dbyug pas nye bar bsnun zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbyug pas nye bar bsnun zhes pa'o //
translated: The stick is used to strike.

original: las gcig pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: las gcig pa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by from the same action?

original: dande n'a hatya tsoo ram go p'a la ko g'a:k'a la ya ti /
analyzed: dande n'a hatya tsoo ram go p'a la ko g'a:k'a la ya ti /
translated: dandena nâhaṃ hatyāco 'urāgalakogāḥ kalayati,

original: 'dir bsnun pa'i las chom rkun te bgrang ba'i las ba lang ngo /
analyzed: 'dir bsnun pa'i las chom rkun te bgrang ba'i las ba lang ngo /
translated: Here the action of striking is that of a thief, the action of counting is that of a cow.

original: hanti'i yas la yang ngo zhes pas lnga pa la dbyi'o //
analyzed: hanti'i yas la yang ngo zhes pas lnga pa la dbyi'o //
translated: The fifth case is also used for the accusative of the object of a verb.

original: bdun pa la'ang tshad dang a'a s'atti dag la'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la'ang tshad dang a'a s'atti dag la'o //
translated: The seventh case is also used for the locative of the standard and the locative of the place.

original: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig dang bdun pa ste /🔽bdun pa'i mtha' la'ang byings las nam 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig dang bdun pa ste / bdun pa'i mtha' la'ang byings las nam 'gyur te /
translated: The third case is used for the locative of the standard and the seventh case is used for the locative of the place.

original: tshad dang a'a satti dag rtogs par bya bzhin pa la'o /
analyzed: tshad dang a'a satti dag rtogs par bya bzhin pa la'o /
translated: The seventh case is also used for the locative of the standard and the locative of the place.

original: 'tshad ni chur dang srid du'o //
analyzed: 'tshad ni chur dang srid du'o //
translated: The standard is in terms of length and breadth.

original: a'a satti ni nye ba'o //🔽re zhig tshad dvyed gu lo ta karsha mi ksham\ tstshi natti /
analyzed: a'a satti ni nye ba'o // re zhig tshad dvyed gu lo ta karsha mi ksham\ tstshi natti /
translated: The place is nearby.🔽The standard is divided into the standard of the field and the standard of the plough.

original: dvyangku le not karsha /
analyzed: dvyangku le not karsha /
translated: The standard of the field is not the standard of the plough.

original: kri sha 'bri ba la'o //
analyzed: kri sha 'bri ba la'o //
translated: kṛṣa, to plough.

original: aud\ sngon du'o //🔽dvya gum lotkarsham /
analyzed: aud\ sngon du'o // dvya gum lotkarsham /
translated: ud, before.🔽dvyam, to draw out.

original: dvyam gu le autkarsham /🔽a'a satti la ke sha gr'a ham yu dhyante /🔽ke shee rgr'a ham /
analyzed: dvyam gu le autkarsham / a'a satti la ke sha gr'a ham yu dhyante / ke shee rgr'a ham /
translated: dvyam, to draw out.🔽ā, to seize.🔽keśa, hair.

original: kee she shu gr'a ham /
analyzed: kee she shu gr'a ham /
translated: keśa, hair.

original: @306b gsum pa dang bdun pa dag nye ba'i tshig la au pa sngon ma las p'id dang ru dhi dang / kri shi rnams las nam bshad par bya ste /

original: tshul grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: kun du bsten pa la ni bya ba brjod pa'i aa nu pra be sha sogs rnams gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: kun du bsten pa la ni bya ba brjod pa'i aa nu pra be sha sogs rnams gnyis brjod do //

analyzed: bya ba dang lhan cig pa'i srid kyi rdzas kyi tshul grub pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: gang gi tshe gsum pa sogs rnams kyi yang na'o zhes pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gsum pa sogs rnams kyi yang na'o zhes pas /
translated: When the third case, etc., is also expressed by the word na,

original: phyogs gcig la tshig sdud pa de'i tshe ni de nyid kyis khyab pa dang kun du bsten pa dag brjod pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis brjod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la tshig sdud pa de'i tshe ni de nyid kyis khyab pa dang kun du bsten pa dag brjod pa nyid kyi phyir gnyis brjod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the word is contracted in one place, then at that time, because the pervasion and the frequentative are expressed by that very word, it is not the case that two are expressed.

original: ge h'a nu pra be sham a'aste /
analyzed: ge h'a nu pra be sham a'aste /

original: 'o na tshig pa sdus pa khyab pa dang bsten pa dag 'chad pa'i ched du ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshig pa sdus pa khyab pa dang bsten pa dag 'chad pa'i ched du ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the contracted word expresses the pervasion and the frequentative?

original: mngon par brjod pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i nus pa'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: It is from the nature of the power of verbal expression.

original: dus rnams la dri sha aas su dag gi bya ba'i bar la'o //
analyzed: dus rnams la dri sha aas su dag gi bya ba'i bar la'o //
translated: In the case of the times, it is in the case of the action of the dṛś-śaṃs-su.

original: bya ba gzhan byed do //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan byed do //
translated: It is the action of another.

original: bya ba'i bar gyi dus brjod pa la gnyis pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig rnams la bya ba'i bar te bya ba chod pa la byings kyi don la 'jug bzhin pa las /

translated: In the expression of the time of the action, the words of the second case are in the middle of the action. In the middle of the action that is interrupted, the meaning of the root is engaged.

original: tri shi dang aa sya ti dag las nam 'gyur ro //🔽dva ham tarsham g'a:p'a pa ya ti /
analyzed: tri shi dang aa sya ti dag las nam 'gyur ro // dva ham tarsham g'a:p'a pa ya ti /

original: dva ham tarsham /
analyzed: dva ham tarsham /

analyzed: 'dir skom pas 'thung ba'i bya ba chod pa nyid do // dvya ha tyam sam g'a:pa pa ya ti /

original: dva ha ma tya sam /
analyzed: dva ha ma tya sam /

analyzed: 'dir yang aa ti aa pa na la 'thung ba'i bya bas chod pa'o //

original: bya ba'i bar la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba'i bar la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: aa ha rarya pye shu na ga ta:/
analyzed: aa ha rarya pye shu na ga ta:/

original: 'dir aarya pa nas ga ta la ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir aarya pa nas ga ta la ma chod pa'o //

original: dus rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dus rnams la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: yo dza na ma tyapya g'a: pa ya pa ti /
analyzed: yo dza na ma tyapya g'a: pa ya pa ti /

analyzed: n'a minal a'a di shi gra ha dag gi'o //

original: na mina'i sgra gnyis pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig a'ang sngon ma'i de shi dang gra ha las kyang nam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na mina'i sgra gnyis pa'i mtha' nye ba'i tshig a'ang sngon ma'i de shi dang gra ha las kyang nam 'gyur ro //

analyzed: n'a m'a n+ye de sha m'a hva ya ti /

original: n'a m'a gra ha m'a hva ya ti /

original: n'a m'a ni gr'a ham /
analyzed: n'a m'a ni gr'a ham /

analyzed: mi zad pa la krinya las ji ltar 'dod pa bshad pa min pa la kta'ang ngo //

analyzed: gang 'dod pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par bshad pa'o //

original: de nas dgag pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas dgag pa'i bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: mi zad pa nye ba'i tshig la kri nya las nam 'gyur te // kta 'ang ngo //

analyzed: rang gi yan lag la tas la'o //

analyzed: tas la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by with regard to tas?🔽 Mukhe kritva

original: mu khe kri tv'a /
analyzed: mu khe kri tv'a /
translated: Mukhe kṛtva.🔽

original: tas kyi rkyen smos pas mi zad pa gzung ste /
analyzed: tas kyi rkyen smos pas mi zad pa gzung ste /
translated: The suffix ta is mentioned as a condition, and it is taken to be inexhaustible.

original: tas khyad par nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tas khyad par nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because ta is a particular.

original: rkyen gyi tas ma gtogs pa'i tas gzhan gyi mi zad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tas ma gtogs pa'i tas gzhan gyi mi zad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that other suffixes besides the conditional ta are not inexhaustible.

original: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is not the case here.

original: mu kha ta:kri tv'a ga ta:/
analyzed: mu kha ta:kri tv'a ga ta:/
translated: Mukhatah, kṛtvā, gatāḥ.

original: tas su nye bar zad pa la'o zhes pa 'di las kvi pa'o //
analyzed: tas su nye bar zad pa la'o zhes pa 'di las kvi pa'o //
translated: In this, the suffix ta is for exhaustion.

original: tiryak\/ nye ba'i tshig la yongs su rdzogs pa rtogs par bya bzhin pa la krinya las ktv'a dang nam bshad par bya ste /🔽t'iryak kri tv'a /
analyzed: tiryak\/ nye ba'i tshig la yongs su rdzogs pa rtogs par bya bzhin pa la krinya las ktv'a dang nam bshad par bya ste / t'iryak kri tv'a /
translated: In the vicinity, the complete is to be understood. In the explanation of kṛtya, ktvā and nam are explained.🔽Tirik, kṛtvā.

original: tiryaka kri tv'a /
analyzed: tiryaka kri tv'a /
translated: Tirik, kṛtvā.

original: tiryak\ k'a ram /
analyzed: tiryak\ k'a ram /
translated: Tirik, kāraṃ.

original: rdzogs pa rtogs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa rtogs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the complete is understood.

original: rdzogs pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rdzogs pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of in the complete?

original: tiryaka kri tv'a la t'a ga ta:/
analyzed: tiryaka kri tv'a la t'a ga ta:/
translated: Tirik, kṛtvā, gatāḥ.

original: tushni m'a zhes pa la'ang bh'u las so //
analyzed: tushni m'a zhes pa la'ang bh'u las so //

original: tushni zhes pa bdun pa phyis pa can no //
analyzed: tushni zhes pa bdun pa phyis pa can no //

original: tushnim gyi sgra nye ba'i tshig la bha ba ti las ktva dang nam\ dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tushnim gyi sgra nye ba'i tshig la bha ba ti las ktva dang nam\ dag 'gyur ro //
translated: In the vicinity of the word tusnim, ktvā and nam are formed from bhavati.

original: tushnim tv'i bhu dh'a tishtha ti tushni ma bhu ya /
analyzed: tushnim tv'i bhu dh'a tishtha ti tushni ma bhu ya /

original: tushni bh'a bam /
analyzed: tushni bh'a bam /

original: rang gi yan lag la tas la'o zhes pa 'ga' zhig tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: rang gi yan lag la tas la'o zhes pa 'ga' zhig tu 'jug ste /

original: des na / mu kha to bhu tv'a /🔽mu kha to bhu ya /
analyzed: des na / mu kha to bhu tv'a / mu kha to bhu ya /
translated: Therefore, mukha ta bhūta.🔽Mukha ta bhuyaḥ.

original: mu kha to bh'a bam /
analyzed: mu kha to bh'a bam /
translated: Mukha ta bhāvaṃ.

original: zhes pa'i sgra tshig gzhan nye ba la yang ktva dang nam dag 'jug go zhes pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sgra tshig gzhan nye ba la yang ktva dang nam dag 'jug go zhes pa'i don du'o //

original: des na / n'a n'a bhu ya /🔽n'a n'a bhu ya /
analyzed: des na / n'a n'a bhu ya / n'a n'a bhu ya /

original: n'a n'a bh'a ba /🔽bi n'a bhu tv'a /🔽bi n'a bhu ya /
analyzed: n'a n'a bh'a ba / bi n'a bhu tv'a / bi n'a bhu ya /

original: bi na bh'a bam /🔽dva dh'i bhu ta /🔽dva dh'i bhu ya /
analyzed: bi na bh'a bam / dva dh'i bhu ta / dva dh'i bhu ya /

original: tva dh'i bh'a bam /🔽dvee dhi bham ya /🔽dvee dhi bhm ya /
analyzed: tva dh'i bh'a bam / dvee dhi bham ya / dvee dhi bhm ya /

analyzed: dvee dham bhu bam / 'di rnams nye ba'i tshig las krinya las kyang /

original: ktv'a dang nam dag blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ktv'a dang nam dag blta bar bya ste /

original: n'a n'a kri tv'a n'a n'a kri tya /
analyzed: n'a n'a kri tv'a n'a n'a kri tya /

original: n'a n'a ka ram /
analyzed: n'a n'a ka ram /

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dper brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dper brjod par bya'o //

original: yod pa'i don rnams dang / shak dhrisha dznya gl'a gha dar bha la bha kra ma sa ha aa dha rnams la tuma'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i don rnams dang / shak dhrisha dznya gl'a gha dar bha la bha kra ma sa ha aa dha rnams la tuma'o //

analyzed: @308a * // gang rnams la don yod pa de ni yod pa'i don rnams so //

original: de nas zlas dbye'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye'o //

original: yod bzhin pa'i don rnams la'ang ngo //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa'i don rnams la'ang ngo //

analyzed: shakno ti bhoktum / dhrishno ti bhiktu / dz'a n'a ti bhoktum / gl'a ya ti bhoktum /

analyzed: a'a la bha te bhoktum /

original: pra kra ma te bhoktum /
analyzed: pra kra ma te bhoktum /

analyzed: autpa ha ta bhoktum / aa dha te bhoktum /

analyzed: aasti bhoktum / bha ba ti bhoktum /

original: birya te bhoktum /
analyzed: birya te bhoktum /

analyzed: don nges pa bsten pa med pa'i rkyen rnams rang gi don la 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig las rang gi don la ni krit rnams 'gyur bas so ;
translated: The application of the affix kvip to the root bhū, meaning to be, is for the purpose of the non-application of the affix kvip.

original: / k'a ra ka:/🔽karta / kum bha ka ra:/🔽rkyen gang rnams kyi don bstan pa med de rnams kyi don 'dis bsgrub par bya'i gang rnams don so sor nges par thob 'dod pa rnams ni ma yin te /🔽des na / nagna ba li ta pri ya zhes khut 'di byed pa la byas pa byed pa po la mi 'gyur ro //🔽dngos po dang las dag la kritya kta kha la'i don rnams so //

translated: The application of the affix kvip

original: gang gi don de yul khal lta bu yin pa de ni kha la'i don no //
analyzed: gang gi don de yul khal lta bu yin pa de ni kha la'i don no //
translated: The meaning of that, which is the object, is the meaning of khalla.

original: dngos po dang las kyi don la'ang kri tya dang kta dang kha la'i don rnams 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang las kyi don la'ang kri tya dang kta dang kha la'i don rnams 'gyur ro //

original: byed pa po la thob ba la'o //
analyzed: byed pa po la thob ba la'o //
translated: The meaning of kṛtya is the agent.

original: don smos pa ni khal dang ldan cig spyod pa'i yul de gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: don smos pa ni khal dang ldan cig spyod pa'i yul de gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of the meaning is for the purpose of taking the object that is the object of the meaning of khalla.

original: dngos po la kritya rnams ni /
analyzed: dngos po la kritya rnams ni /

original: a'a si ta bya bha ba t'a /
analyzed: a'a si ta bya bha ba t'a /
translated: āsitaṃ bhavati

original: sha ya n'i yam bha ba ta /
analyzed: sha ya n'i yam bha ba ta /
translated: śayanīyaṃ bhavati

original: las la / karta bya:/🔽ka to bha ba t'a /
analyzed: las la / karta bya:/ ka to bha ba t'a /
translated: kṛtaṃ bhavati🔽bhojyaṃ bhavati

original: bho dzya:/ ao da no bha ba t'a /
analyzed: bho dzya:/ ao da no bha ba t'a /
translated: odanaṃ bhavati

original: dngos po la kta ni /🔽a'a si tam bha ba t'a /
analyzed: dngos po la kta ni / a'a si tam bha ba t'a /
translated: The kta affixes are:🔽āsitaṃ bhavati

original: las la kta ni /🔽kri ta:/ ka to bha ba t'a /
analyzed: las la kta ni / kri ta:/ ka to bha ba t'a /
translated: kṛtaṃ bhavati

original: dngos po la khal ni /
analyzed: dngos po la khal ni /
translated: khalā is:🔽āśadhyaṃ bhavati

original: a'i sha da hya bha bam bha ba t'a /🔽phyug po ma yin pa slabs phyug por 'byung ngo zhes byed pa po dang las dag la'ang bhu kriny dag gi zhes pas khala'o //
analyzed: a'i sha da hya bha bam bha ba t'a / phyug po ma yin pa slabs phyug por 'byung ngo zhes byed pa po dang las dag la'ang bhu kriny dag gi zhes pas khala'o //
translated: bhavati

original: las la bala ni /
analyzed: las la bala ni /
translated: khalā is:🔽khalā is:

original: a'i shatkri ta ka to bha ba t'a /
analyzed: a'i shatkri ta ka to bha ba t'a /
translated: āt, śat, kṛt, kta, and bhavat.

original: sla bas bya'o zhes /
analyzed: sla bas bya'o zhes /
translated: [The suffix] kta is added to the root su, 'to be easy,' with the meaning 'to be done easily.'

original: a'i sha da du thur su rnams la'o zhes pas khal\'o /
analyzed: a'i sha da du thur su rnams la'o zhes pas khal\'o /
translated: [The suffix] kta is added to the roots āt, dad, and tur with the meaning 'to be done.'

original: dngos po la yu ni /🔽a'i shat sth'a nam bha ba tv'a /
analyzed: dngos po la yu ni / a'i shat sth'a nam bha ba tv'a /
translated: [The suffix] yuna is added to a substantive.

original: bde bar gnas so zhes pa'o /
analyzed: bde bar gnas so zhes pa'o /
translated: [The suffix] kta is added to the root sthā, 'to stand,' with the meaning 'to stand well.'

original: a'at rnams la da ri dra t'i min pa las yu @308b zhes pas yu'o //
analyzed: a'at rnams la da ri dra t'i min pa las yu @308b zhes pas yu'o //
translated: [The suffix] yuna is added to the roots āt, etc., except for dri and dra, with the meaning 'to be done.'

original: las la yu ni /
analyzed: las la yu ni /
translated: [The suffix] yuna is added to the root kṛ, 'to do,' with the meaning 'to be done.'

original: a'i shadd'a no goo ra bha ba dang / bde bas sbyin par bya'o zhes snga ma bzhin du yu'o //
analyzed: a'i shadd'a no goo ra bha ba dang / bde bas sbyin par bya'o zhes snga ma bzhin du yu'o //
translated: [The suffix] kta is added to the root su, 'to be happy,' with the meaning 'to be given happily,' as before, with the meaning 'to be done.'

original: dang pho'i las las la byed pa po la'ang kta'o //
analyzed: dang pho'i las las la byed pa po la'ang kta'o //
translated: And [the suffix] kta is added to the root kṛ, 'to do,' with the meaning 'to be done,' with the agent being the object of the action.🔽And [the suffix] kta is added to the root kṛ, 'to do,' with the meaning 'to be done,' with the agent being the object of the action.

original: dang po byung ba'i bya ba'i skad cig ni dang po'i las so //
analyzed: dang po byung ba'i bya ba'i skad cig ni dang po'i las so //
translated: The moment of the first action is the first action.

original: de la kta'i rkyen byas pa gang yin pa de byed pa po la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kta'i rkyen byas pa gang yin pa de byed pa po la 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is conditioned by kta in that [first action] becomes the agent.

original: 'ang gi sgra las ji ltar thob ba bzhin 'ang ngo //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra las ji ltar thob ba bzhin 'ang ngo //
translated: By the word 'also,' it is also as obtained.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: slar yang dang po'i las la kta byas pas dang po'i las 'gyur bar 'gyur ba nishtha'o zhes pa 'di nyid kyis so //
analyzed: slar yang dang po'i las la kta byas pas dang po'i las 'gyur bar 'gyur ba nishtha'o zhes pa 'di nyid kyis so //
translated: By kta being added again to the first action, the first action becomes the object of the action. This is by this very [rule].

original: byed pa po la /
analyzed: byed pa po la /
translated: With regard to the agent,

original: pra kri ta ka tam de ba datta:/
analyzed: pra kri ta ka tam de ba datta:/
translated: prākr̥takasya kartṛtvaṃ devadattasya

original: byed 'dod dang por 'jug ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: byed 'dod dang por 'jug ces pa'i don to //
translated: means “the activity of Devadatta, who is inclined to act, is first engaged.”

original: dngos po la /
analyzed: dngos po la /
translated: With regard to the object,

original: pra kri tam ka to de batten /
analyzed: pra kri tam ka to de batten /
translated: prākr̥tasya kartṛtvaṃ devadattena🔽means “the activity of Devadatta, who is inclined to act, is first engaged.”

original: las la / pra krita /
analyzed: las la / pra krita /
translated: With regard to the action,

original: ga to de ba datte na /
analyzed: ga to de ba datte na /
translated: prākr̥tasya kartṛtvaṃ devadattasya

original: byed 'dod dang por 'jug go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byed 'dod dang por 'jug go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means “the activity of Devadatta, who is inclined to act, is first engaged.”

original: pra'i sgra ni po'i las gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pra'i sgra ni po'i las gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The word prā means “to make clear.”

original: 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa dang / a'a shlisha shing sth'a a'as pas dza na ru ha dzir++ya ti rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa dang / a'a shlisha shing sth'a a'as pas dza na ru ha dzir++ya ti rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Those that have the meaning of “going,” those that have no action, and those that have the meaning of “connection” and “existence” are also [included].

original: gang rnams kyi don 'gro ba yin pa de rnams ni 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi don 'gro ba yin pa de rnams ni 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Those that have the meaning of “going” are those that have the meaning of “going.”

original: gang rnams kyi las yod pa ma yin pa de rnams ni las med pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi las yod pa ma yin pa de rnams ni las med pa'o //
translated: Those that have no action are those that have no action.

original: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: Then, the compound [is formed].

original: 'gro ba'i don rnams dang las med pa rnams dang / a'ang sngon ma can gyi shlisha dang / shing dang / sth'a dang / a'as dang / bas dang / dz'a na ru ha dang / dz'ir++ya ti zhes pa 'di rnams kyang kta'i rkyen gang yin pa de byed pa po la 'gyur ro //🔽kyang gyi sgra las ji ltar thob pa bzhin yang ngo //🔽byed pa po la /🔽ga to gra mam de ba datta:/
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don rnams dang las med pa rnams dang / a'ang sngon ma can gyi shlisha dang / shing dang / sth'a dang / a'as dang / bas dang / dz'a na ru ha dang / dz'ir++ya ti zhes pa 'di rnams kyang kta'i rkyen gang yin pa de byed pa po la 'gyur ro // kyang gyi sgra las ji ltar thob pa bzhin yang ngo // byed pa po la / ga to gra mam de ba datta:/

analyzed: bhi ma:/ bh'ishma:/ 'di las 'jig par byed do zhes ma ka'o //
