translated: The ka and ga are for the ca and ja, which are followed by the dhūta and gha.

original: tsa yig dang @310a * //
analyzed: tsa yig dang @310a * //
translated: The ca and ja

original: dza yig dag dh'ut dang gha rjes su 'brel pa pha rol la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dza yig dag dh'ut dang gha rjes su 'brel pa pha rol la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: are followed by the dhūta and gha.

original: ka dang ga dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu mtshan so sor grangs ji lta ba bzhin du //
analyzed: ka dang ga dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // rgyu mtshan so sor grangs ji lta ba bzhin du //
translated: They are changed to the ka and ga, respectively.🔽The reason is that they are not permanent.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir grangs ji ltar ba bzhin yongs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir grangs ji ltar ba bzhin yongs su bshad pa'o //
translated: They are explained according to the number.

original: pakta / p'a ka:/
analyzed: pakta / p'a ka:/
translated: Pakta, pākaḥ.

original: tyaktam / tyag:/ bh'ugna:/🔽bhugna:/ bhanydzo kun nas nyed pa la'o //
analyzed: tyaktam / tyag:/ bh'ugna:/ bhugna:/ bhanydzo kun nas nyed pa la'o //
translated: Tyaktaṃ, tyaja.🔽Bhūktaṃ, bhuktaṃ.🔽Bhūjja, bhūjja.🔽Bhūjja is for “having eaten.”

original: bh'u dzo 'khyog po la'o //
analyzed: bh'u dzo 'khyog po la'o //
translated: Bhūjja is for “having bent.”

original: kun nas nyed par byas zin /
analyzed: kun nas nyed par byas zin /
translated: Having eaten, having bent.

original: kun nas 'khyog par byas zin la kta'i rkyen no //
analyzed: kun nas 'khyog par byas zin la kta'i rkyen no //
translated: The ka suffix is for the past.

original: ait rjes su 'drel pa ma yin pa zhes pas na dbyi'o /'dis ga'o //
analyzed: ait rjes su 'drel pa ma yin pa zhes pas na dbyi'o /'dis ga'o //
translated: The i is not followed by another.🔽The ga is for the ka.

original: lu sogs dang yongs rjes su 'brel ba las zhes pas na nyid do //
analyzed: lu sogs dang yongs rjes su 'brel ba las zhes pas na nyid do //
translated: The ya is for the lu and so on.🔽The ya is for the paryupāsita.

original: 'o na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gzhan nyid kyi phyir nyid du gyur pa na de las dh'ut med pa'i phyir ga nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gzhan nyid kyi phyir nyid du gyur pa na de las dh'ut med pa'i phyir ga nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the permanent and the impermanent are different, then how can the impermanent become the permanent?

original: 'di yod mod 'on kyang nges pa la sogs pa yan lag gzhan stobs dang ldan pa las so //
analyzed: 'di yod mod 'on kyang nges pa la sogs pa yan lag gzhan stobs dang ldan pa las so //
translated: This is true, but from the power of other factors, such as necessity, etc.

original: de na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snga ma phyi ma bsgyur ba la /
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma bsgyur ba la /
translated: When the former is transformed into the latter,

original: phyi ma'i nges pa rtag pa nyid //🔽yan lag gzhan gyi nges pa la //
analyzed: phyi ma'i nges pa rtag pa nyid // yan lag gzhan gyi nges pa la //
translated: the necessity of the latter is permanence.🔽When there is the necessity of another factor,

original: nye ba'i yan lag gzhan de bzhin //
analyzed: nye ba'i yan lag gzhan de bzhin //
translated: the other factor is a subsidiary factor.

original: bsgrub pa gzhan khas stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gzhan khas stobs dang ldan //
translated: The proof of another is powerful.

original: dngos su bsgrub pa byas pa las //
analyzed: dngos su bsgrub pa byas pa las //
translated: From the performance of the actual proof,

original: de las gzhan rtogs pa nyid phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan rtogs pa nyid phyir //
translated: because of the understanding of that other,

original: sngon du ga nyid de nas na //
analyzed: sngon du ga nyid de nas na //
translated: first there is the impermanent, then the permanent.

original: ji ltar yan lag gzhan nyid rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag gzhan nyid rtogs she na /
translated: How is the understanding of another factor?

original: dkyus ma la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyus ma la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on the normal.

original: gal te de yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: smras pa / 'dir byed brag tu rtogs pa'i sgra rkyen dang por nges par 'phen pas dkyus ma gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir byed brag tu rtogs pa'i sgra rkyen dang por nges par 'phen pas dkyus ma gsal bar byed la /
translated: It is said: Here, the sound of the particular is impelled by the first condition, and so it clarifies the basic.

original: phyi nas nye ba'i rkyen de dag 'phen bzhin pas gang gzhan 'phen par byed pa de rang gi yan lag dang cig shos ni phyi'i yan lag go //
analyzed: phyi nas nye ba'i rkyen de dag 'phen bzhin pas gang gzhan 'phen par byed pa de rang gi yan lag dang cig shos ni phyi'i yan lag go //
translated: Later, while impelling those proximate conditions, whatever impels something else is its own member, and the other is the external member.

original: des na dkyus ma la brten pa'i nang gi yan lag la brten nas phyi'i yan lag rtogs so zhes rab tu 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na dkyus ma la brten pa'i nang gi yan lag la brten nas phyi'i yan lag rtogs so zhes rab tu 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is well established that the external member is understood in dependence on the internal member that is based on the basic.

original: n+yang ku sogs rnams kyi ha'i rang gha'o //
analyzed: n+yang ku sogs rnams kyi ha'i rang gha'o //
translated: The ha of nyangu and so on is gha.

original: tsa dza dag gi ka ga dag go zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: tsa dza dag gi ka ga dag go zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: The ca and ja of tsa and dza are ka and ga.

original: n+yang ku la sogs pa rnams kyi tsa dza dag ka ga dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: n+yang ku la sogs pa rnams kyi tsa dza dag ka ga dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: The ca and ja of nyangu and so on become ka and ga.

original: de rnams kyi ha yig gang yin pa de yang gha nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ha yig gang yin pa de yang gha nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, whatever ha syllable they have becomes gha.🔽Nyangu.

original: n+yam ku:/ aantsi las ni sngon du'o //
analyzed: n+yam ku:/ aantsi las ni sngon du'o //
translated: From anaci, previously.

original: ni la aanytsi las so zhes pas au'i rkyen no //
analyzed: ni la aanytsi las so zhes pas au'i rkyen no //
translated: From nili anaci, the condition of u.

original: tsa'i ka nyid do /
analyzed: tsa'i ka nyid do /
translated: The ca is ka itself.

original: bhri gu:/ pra thi mrid bhra dza rnams kyi sam pra s'a ra na ste ba dbyi ba yang ngo zhes pas bhrasdza las au'i rkyen no //
analyzed: bhri gu:/ pra thi mrid bhra dza rnams kyi sam pra s'a ra na ste ba dbyi ba yang ngo zhes pas bhrasdza las au'i rkyen no //
translated: Thus, from bhr̥j, the u suffix.

original: sam pra s'a ra na dang sa dbyi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sam pra s'a ra na dang sa dbyi ba yang ngo //
translated: Samprāsāraṇa and avyayam.🔽By this, ga.

original: 'dis ga'o // aa ba d'agha:/
analyzed: 'dis ga'o // aa ba d'agha:/
translated: Avadgha.

original: da hi las ghanya'o //
analyzed: da hi las ghanya'o //
translated: From dhi, gnya.🔽By this, gha.

original: 'dis gha'o // n+yam ku:/
analyzed: 'dis gha'o // n+yam ku:/
translated: Nyamku.🔽Bhr̥gu.🔽Mangku.

original: bhrigu:/ manggu:/ d'u re p'a ka:/
analyzed: bhrigu:/ manggu:/ d'u re p'a ka:/
translated: Dūrepakṣa.🔽Sphulopakṣa.

original: sphalo p'a ka:/ bi sham ga:/
analyzed: sphalo p'a ka:/ bi sham ga:/
translated: Viśaṅga.🔽Megha.

original: me gha:/ shva p'a ka:/
analyzed: me gha:/ shva p'a ka:/
translated: Śvapāka.🔽Takra.

original: takram / ba krung /
analyzed: takram / ba krung /
translated: Bakra.🔽Nakva.

original: na kva:/ aa ba d'a gha:/🔽@310b ni d'a gha:/
analyzed: na kva:/ aa ba d'a gha:/ @310b ni d'a gha:/
translated: Avadgha.🔽Niṣadha.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rnams na n+yang kun sogs rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rnams na n+yang kun sogs rnams so //
translated: Thus, nyamku and so forth.

original: ka sde dang po dang bra dzi aa dzi rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: ka sde dang po dang bra dzi aa dzi rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: Not from the first of the ka group and from bhr̥j, aj.

original: dbyings ka sde dang po can dang bra dzi dang aa dzi las kyang tsa dang dza dag gi ka dang ga dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyings ka sde dang po can dang bra dzi dang aa dzi las kyang tsa dang dza dag gi ka dang ga dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, from the long ā of the ka group and from bhr̥j, aj, the ka and ga of ca and ja do not occur.🔽Kuja.🔽Kharj.

original: ku dza:/ khardza:/ gardza:/
analyzed: ku dza:/ khardza:/ gardza:/
translated: Garj.

original: ku dza sgra la'o //
analyzed: ku dza sgra la'o //
translated: Kuja is for sound.

original: khardza 'phyid pa la'o //
analyzed: khardza 'phyid pa la'o //
translated: Kharj is for yawning.

original: gardza sgra la'o //🔽ghanya'o // kudzyam /🔽ghyana'o // pa ri bra dza:/
analyzed: gardza sgra la'o // ghanya'o // kudzyam / ghyana'o // pa ri bra dza:/

analyzed: sa m'a dza:/ gha nya'o // ma yin no zhes bya ba la sbyor ba rnam par gzhag par byas pa ni yang ba'i don te / des ni 'dir yang ji ltar mthong ba bzhin dgag pa'o //
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GVA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GHA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GDA.

analyzed: bhra dza:/ tardza:/ bhri dza gsal ba la'o // gha nya'o // de bzhin du /
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GDHĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GNA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GCA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GCHĀ.

original: sho tsya:/ tv'a dzya:/🔽shu tsa mya ngan la'o //🔽tya dza long ba la'o //
analyzed: sho tsya:/ tv'a dzya:/ shu tsa mya ngan la'o // tya dza long ba la'o //

analyzed: ghyana'o // 'o na shokya: zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GTA.

analyzed: shuk 'gro ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i gzugs so //
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GTHĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GDA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GDHĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GNA.

original: ghyan la gdon mi za ba la'o //
analyzed: ghyan la gdon mi za ba la'o //
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GCA.

analyzed: gdon mi ba'i don la ghyan gang yin pa de pha rol la tsa dang dza dag gi ka dang ga dag tu mi 'gyur ro // aa ba shya p'a tsyam /

original: aa ba shya y'a dzyam /🔽gdon mi za ba'i don la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa ba shya y'a dzyam /🔽gdon mi za ba'i don la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GJA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GJHĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GÑĀ.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the sound of the letter GTA.🔽The sound of the letter GHA is the

original: p'a kyam / pra sngon ma'i ba tsi dang / aartsi dang ru tsi dang y'a tsi dang yadzi rnams kyi ghyan pha rol la tsa dza dag gi ka ga dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: p'a kyam / pra sngon ma'i ba tsi dang / aartsi dang ru tsi dang y'a tsi dang yadzi rnams kyi ghyan pha rol la tsa dza dag gi ka ga dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the past participles of the verbs pac, arś, ruci, yaci, and yaji, the k and g of the ka and ga groups do not become k and g, respectively, in the case of the suffix ghya.🔽It is not necessarily so.

original: gdon mi za ba'i don brjod pa ma yin no //🔽pra b'a tsya:/ aartsya:/
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i don brjod pa ma yin no // pra b'a tsya:/ aartsya:/
translated: pravācyam🔽arśyam

original: ro tsya:/ ya tsya:/
analyzed: ro tsya:/ ya tsya:/
translated: rocyam🔽yacyam

original: y'a dzya:/ pra b'atsya:/
analyzed: y'a dzya:/ pra b'atsya:/
translated: yājyam🔽pravācyam

original: zhes pa'i gzhung gi khyad par 'ga' zhig gi ming ngo ;
analyzed: zhes pa'i gzhung gi khyad par 'ga' zhig gi ming ngo ;
translated: The above are the names of some special texts.

original: / btsa'i sgra ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: / btsa'i sgra ma yin pa la'o //
translated: The word baci is not a sound.

original: ba tsi sgra ma yin pa'i yul la ghyan pha rol la ka nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba tsi sgra ma yin pa'i yul la ghyan pha rol la ka nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the object that is not a sound, the k of baci does not become k in the case of the suffix ghya.🔽bācyam

original: b'a tsyam / sgra ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: b'a tsyam / sgra ma yin pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “not a sound”?

original: b'a kyam / ni pra dag las yu dza'i nus pa la'o //
analyzed: b'a kyam / ni pra dag las yu dza'i nus pa la'o //
translated: bākyam

original: ni dang pra dag las pha rol gyi yu dzi'i nus pa'i don la ghyan pha rol la ga nyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽nges par sbyor nus pa ni /
analyzed: ni dang pra dag las pha rol gyi yu dzi'i nus pa'i don la ghyan pha rol la ga nyid du mi 'gyur ro // nges par sbyor nus pa ni /
translated: In the case of the suffix yuj, the ni and pra of the ka and ga groups do not become g in the case of the suffix ghya.🔽niyujyam

original: ni yo dzya:/ rab tu sbyor nus pa ni /
analyzed: ni yo dzya:/ rab tu sbyor nus pa ni /

original: pra yo dzya:/ nus pa zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽nges par sbyor nus pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: pra yo dzya:/ nus pa zhes pa ci zhe na / nges par sbyor nus pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: What is the meaning of the word 'power'?🔽[The word] 'power' [means] the ability to join.

original: ni yo gya:/ rab tu sbyor bar nus pa ma yin pa ni /🔽pra yo gya:/ bhu dza'i zas la'o //
analyzed: ni yo gya:/ rab tu sbyor bar nus pa ma yin pa ni / pra yo gya:/ bhu dza'i zas la'o //
translated: [The word] 'power' [means] the ability to apply.🔽[The word] 'bhojya' is for food.🔽[The word] 'bhojya' is for the object of food.

original: zas kyi yul la bh'u dzi las ghyan pha rol la gnyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽bho dzyam p'a ya sam /
analyzed: zas kyi yul la bh'u dzi las ghyan pha rol la gnyid du mi 'gyur ro // bho dzyam p'a ya sam /
translated: [The word] 'bhojya' is for food.

original: zas la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: zas la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word 'food'?

original: bho gya:/ sh'a ta ka:/
analyzed: bho gya:/ sh'a ta ka:/
translated: [The word] 'bhoga' [means] food.

original: bh'u dza n+yupdza dag lag pa dang nad dag la'o //
analyzed: bh'u dza n+yupdza dag lag pa dang nad dag la'o //
translated: [The word] 'bhujya' [means] hand and disease.

original: 'di dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin du lag pa dang nad kyi don dag la tshig phrad do //
analyzed: 'di dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin du lag pa dang nad kyi don dag la tshig phrad do //

original: bh'udzi dang aupdza bsnams pa la'o zhes pa 'di'ang ni sngon ma'i ghanya pha rol la gnyid dang yon tan nyid dag med do //🔽lag pa dang nad dag la zhes @311a * //

original: pa ce zhe na /
analyzed: pa ce zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word 'hand' and 'disease'?🔽[The word] 'bhoga' [means] hand and disease.

original: bho ga:/ n+yupga:/ dri ka dri sha driksha rnams las m'a na'i sa'o //
analyzed: bho ga:/ n+yupga:/ dri ka dri sha driksha rnams las m'a na'i sa'o //
translated: [The word] 'nyupja' [means] hand and disease.🔽[The word] 'nyupja' [means] hand and disease.

original: sa m'a na'i sgras zhes pa 'dir bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa m'a na'i sgras zhes pa 'dir bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word samāna is to be supplied here.

original: drik dang dri sha dang driksha zhes pa 'di rnams pha rol la'o //
analyzed: drik dang dri sha dang driksha zhes pa 'di rnams pha rol la'o //
translated: The words trika, triśa, and trikṣa are for the other.

original: 'o na m'a na'i sgra las pha rol gyi drik sogs rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ci ltar de rnams kyi rgyu mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: bden te / shes par byed pa'i tshig gi 'di nyid ni sa m'a na /
translated: It is true, but this very word, which causes understanding, is samāna.

translated: From the previous

analyzed: dri shir lta ba la'o //

analyzed: sa m'an sngon du'o //

analyzed: tsha sha dag gi 'ong ngo zhes pas sha'o // kha dha dag gi ka'o //

analyzed: ai dma'i ai'o //

analyzed: ai dma'i drik dang dri sha dang driksha pha rol la a'i nyid du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ai drik / a'i dri sha / a'i dri ksha:/

translated: In the case of the action of “this is like that,”🔽the kvip, the ta, and the saka are changed to

analyzed: tyad la sogs pa la kvip dang tak dang sak rnams 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ki ma'i ki'o //

analyzed: ki ma'i drik dri sha driksha rnams pha rol la k'i ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The i of ki mi, the i of drik, the i of drikṣa, and the i of drikṣa become the ki of the other side.🔽ki drik

analyzed: k'i drik / k'i driksha:/
translated: ki drikṣa

original: ci lta bu 'dra zhes pas kvip dang dak dang sa ka dag gi rkyen dag 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci lta bu 'dra zhes pas kvip dang dak dang sa ka dag gi rkyen dag 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of “what is like what,” the kvip, the ta, and the saka are changed to🔽a, da, and amu.

original: aa das aa mu'o //
analyzed: aa das aa mu'o //
translated: a da a mu

original: aa dasa'i drik dri sha driksha rnams pha rol la aa mu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa dasa'i drik dri sha driksha rnams pha rol la aa mu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The i of a das, the i of drik, the i of drikṣa, and the i of drikṣa become the amu of the other side.🔽a mu drik🔽a mu drikṣa

original: aa mu drik / aa mu dri sha:/
analyzed: aa mu drik / aa mu dri sha:/
translated: a mu drikṣa

original: aa ma driksha:/ de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aa ma driksha:/ de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It should be understood in the same way.🔽sarvanāmāṃ i

original: sarba n'a ma'i a'i'i zhes pas aa das kyi a'a nyid du byas pa na /
analyzed: sarba n'a ma'i a'i'i zhes pas aa das kyi a'a nyid du byas pa na /
translated: In the case of a das, the i becomes a.

original: de'i yang ma nyid la ma las au nyid do zhes pas aa yig gi au nyid la yang aa mu drik ces pa la sogs pa sbyor ba brtsams pa don med do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de'i yang ma nyid la ma las au nyid do zhes pas aa yig gi au nyid la yang aa mu drik ces pa la sogs pa sbyor ba brtsams pa don med do zhes kha cig go //
translated: And in the case of the syllable ma itself, the u is from ma, so it is meaningless to apply the term amudrik to the u of the syllable a and so on.

original: sarba n'a ma'i a'a'o //
analyzed: sarba n'a ma'i a'a'o //
translated: Sarvanāmin

original: drik dri sha driksha rnams pha rol la sarba n'a ma'i a'a nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽t'a drik / t'a dri sha:/🔽t'a driksha:/ y'a dri ka:/
analyzed: drik dri sha driksha rnams pha rol la sarba n'a ma'i a'a nyid du 'gyur ro // t'a drik / t'a dri sha:/ t'a driksha:/ y'a dri ka:/
translated: The terms drik, driśa, and drikṣa become sarvanāmin in the case of the other.🔽Tādṛk, tādṛśa,🔽tādṛkṣa, yādṛk,

original: y'a drisha:/ y'a driksha:/
analyzed: y'a drisha:/ y'a driksha:/
translated: yādṛśa, yādṛkṣa,

original: bi shvaka de ba dag gi 'ang ma'i dbyangs dang po aantsa ti la aa dri'o //
analyzed: bi shvaka de ba dag gi 'ang ma'i dbyangs dang po aantsa ti la aa dri'o //
translated: and viśvadeva also have the first vowel of the term amudri as anutsar.🔽The first vowel of the final of these terms sarva, viśva, and deva becomes the root anutsar and the affix kvip, changing to amdri in the case of the other.

original: sarba n'a ma dang bi shva ka dang de ba zhes pa 'di rnams kyi'ang mtha'i dbyangs dang po gang yin pa de aantsa ti'i byings dang kvipa'i rkyen pha rol la aa dri ru sgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽tadryang / yadryang /
analyzed: sarba n'a ma dang bi shva ka dang de ba zhes pa 'di rnams kyi'ang mtha'i dbyangs dang po gang yin pa de aantsa ti'i byings dang kvipa'i rkyen pha rol la aa dri ru sgyur bar 'gyur ro // tadryang / yadryang /
translated: For example,🔽yadrīṅ,🔽viśvarīṅ,

analyzed: bi shva dryang / de ba dryang / ta ma aanytsa ti /

original: yam aanytsa ti /
analyzed: yam aanytsa ti /

original: bi dva da ka aanytsa ti /
analyzed: bi dva da ka aanytsa ti /

original: de bam aanytsa ti /
analyzed: de bam aanytsa ti /

analyzed: de bam aanytsa ti / zhes @311b la kvipa'o //

original: 'dis aa dri'o //
analyzed: 'dis aa dri'o //

original: aanytsa ti la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aanytsa ti la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: bi shvagyuk / bishva ka ldan no zhes yu dzi las kvipa'o //

original: kvip la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: kvip la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: ba shva ganytsa nam /
analyzed: ba shva ganytsa nam /

original: yuta'o // sa ha sam ti ras rnams kyis dhri sa mi tir rnams so //🔽sa ha dang sam dang ti ras zhes pa 'di rnams kyi aanytsa ti dang kvip pha rol la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: yuta'o // sa ha sam ti ras rnams kyis dhri sa mi tir rnams so // sa ha dang sam dang ti ras zhes pa 'di rnams kyi aanytsa ti dang kvip pha rol la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: The yut, the saṃ, and the ti are the dṛśa.🔽These saṃ, saṃ, and ti are changed to aṃśa and laṅ, respectively, in the other.

original: sa dhri dang sa mi dang ti ri zhes pa 'di rnams su bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽sa h'inytsa ti zhes pa /
analyzed: sa dhri dang sa mi dang ti ri zhes pa 'di rnams su bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // sa h'inytsa ti zhes pa /

original: sa dhryang / sa manytsa ti zhes pa /🔽sa myang / ti ronytsa ti zhes pa /
analyzed: sa dhryang / sa manytsa ti zhes pa / sa myang / ti ronytsa ti zhes pa /

original: tir++yang / ru hi'i yang na dha'o //
analyzed: tir++yang / ru hi'i yang na dha'o //

original: kvip la zhes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: kvip la zhes pa kho na ste /

original: aanytsa ti la zhes pa ldog go //
analyzed: aanytsa ti la zhes pa ldog go //

analyzed: ru hi'i kvip pha rol la dha nyid du yang na 'gyur ro //

original: b'i ruta / b'i ru dhoo //🔽bi ro ha ti zhes la kvipa'o //
analyzed: b'i ruta / b'i ru dhoo // bi ro ha ti zhes la kvipa'o //

original: thung ngu'i ring po'i zhes pas ring po'o /'dir yang nas sgra rnam par gzhag pa rnam par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: thung ngu'i ring po'i zhes pas ring po'o /'dir yang nas sgra rnam par gzhag pa rnam par brjod pa'o //

original: des na rtag tu bi sngon ma'i ru hi'i dha nyid do //
analyzed: des na rtag tu bi sngon ma'i ru hi'i dha nyid do //

original: bh'u ru hoo //
analyzed: bh'u ru hoo //

original: sa las skye zhes la kvipa'o //
analyzed: sa las skye zhes la kvipa'o //

original: byings kyi ma'i na'o //
analyzed: byings kyi ma'i na'o //

analyzed: byings kyi ma yig kvip pha rol la na nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: pra sh'an / pra t'an /
analyzed: pra sh'an / pra t'an /

original: sha mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: sha mu nye bar zhi ba la'o //

original: ta mu 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: ta mu 'dod pa la'o //

original: kv'ipa'o // 'dis ma yig gi na nyid do //
analyzed: kv'ipa'o // 'dis ma yig gi na nyid do //

original: lnga pa'i aupa dha'i zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: lnga pa'i aupa dha'i zhes pas ring po'o //

original: na dbyi ba med de mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: na dbyi ba med de mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: byings smos pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don to //

original: ba ma dag la'ang ngo //
analyzed: ba ma dag la'ang ngo //

analyzed: ma yig gi ba dang ma dag pha rol la na nyid du 'gyur ro // dza ganb'an / kvansu k'an dag ces pas kvanku'o // gnyis brjod do //
translated: The ma of the ma becomes na in the other.🔽The ka and ka of kaṇṭha and kaṇsuka become ku and ku.🔽The ka and ka of kaṇṭha and kaṇsuka become ku and ku.🔽The ka and ka of kaṇṭha and kaṇsuka become ku and ku.

analyzed: ma'i na nyid do // dza ganma // ga mi las tse kri yi ta zhig pa'i mtha' las barta m'a na'i masa'o //
translated: The ma of the feminine becomes na in the masculine.🔽The two, ga and na, become ka and sa respectively.🔽The two, ga and ma, become ka and va respectively.🔽The two, ga and na, become ka and sa respectively.

analyzed: sbyor ba tha dad pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i don ni //

original: a'at ma yin pa ni aat med pa'o //
analyzed: a'at ma yin pa ni aat med pa'o //

analyzed: na zhes pa kho na'o // na yig mtha' can gyi sgra dbyangs pha rol la byings bzhin du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: byings kyi gzugs gang sngar yod pa de na yig mtha' can gyi 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to /

analyzed: a'at ma yin pa ste byings bzhin 'gyur ba las /

analyzed: aa yig dang ldog pa la ches dgag pa byas pa ste a'a yig ni ldog pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //

original: pra sh'a moo //
analyzed: pra sh'a moo //

analyzed: zhes pas ring po'o //

translated: And also for the sake of gam, han, vid, vis, and drs.

original: 'di rnams kyi bansi la dang por ait a'a ma ma yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi bansi la dang por ait a'a ma ma yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: For these, the first is i, and it is for the sake of the change.🔽Jaganvin,

original: dza ganv'ina / gam han zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: dza ganv'ina / gam han zhes pas au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
translated: because of gam han, it is for the sake of upadi.

original: ma ma dag la'o zhes pas na'o //
analyzed: ma ma dag la'o zhes pas na'o //
translated: Because of mama, it is for the sake of na.

original: dzaghni b'an / dza gha nv'an /
analyzed: dzaghni b'an / dza gha nv'an /
translated: Jagha navan, jagha navan,

original: aa bhya sa las kyang ngo zhes pas gha'o //🔽bi bi di b'an /
analyzed: aa bhya sa las kyang ngo zhes pas gha'o // bi bi di b'an /
translated: and also because of abhyasa, it is for the sake of gha.🔽Vibhidavan,

original: bi bi dvan /🔽bi bi shi b'an /
analyzed: bi bi dvan / bi bi shi b'an /
translated: vibhidvana,🔽vibhishavan,

original: bi bi shv'an /🔽da dri @312b shi b'an /
analyzed: bi bi shv'an / da dri @312b shi b'an /
translated: vibhisvan,🔽dadrishavan,

original: da dri shv'an /
analyzed: da dri shv'an /
translated: dadrisvan,

original: bi 'di'i thob pa'i don gyi gzung ba ste /
analyzed: bi 'di'i thob pa'i don gyi gzung ba ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the obtained object of this.

original: tud sogs kyi bi shi dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tud sogs kyi bi shi dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the association with vis, etc., like tud.

original: da shran s'a hvan mi dhan 'ang ngo //
analyzed: da shran s'a hvan mi dhan 'ang ngo //
translated: And also for the sake of dasha, sahavimdha.

original: da shvan dang s'a han dang mi dhan zhes pa 'di rnams tshig phrad do //
analyzed: da shvan dang s'a han dang mi dhan zhes pa 'di rnams tshig phrad do //
translated: Now, daśa, saha, and mithuna are compounds.

original: da shvan / da shri sbyin pa la'o //
analyzed: da shvan / da shri sbyin pa la'o //
translated: Daśa is for giving ten.🔽Kṛtsna, abhyāsa.

original: kransu'o // aa bhy'a sa phyin pa tshig phrad de /
analyzed: kransu'o // aa bhy'a sa phyin pa tshig phrad de /
translated: The word “going” is also a compound.

original: ait med pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: ait med pa'ang ngo //
translated: It is also without ita.

original: s'a hv'an // zhes pa'i sa hi'i ring pa nyid kyang ngo ;
analyzed: s'a hv'an // zhes pa'i sa hi'i ring pa nyid kyang ngo ;
translated: The long ī of saha is also.

original: / m'i dhv'a na //
analyzed: / m'i dhv'a na //
translated: Mithunā.

original: zhes pa'i mi hi'i dha nyid dang ring po nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mi hi'i dha nyid dang ring po nyid kyang ngo //
translated: The dhā of mihi and the long ī are also.

original: shri au yig bri r'it rnams kyi ka rjes su 'brel ba la ma yin no //
analyzed: shri au yig bri r'it rnams kyi ka rjes su 'brel ba la ma yin no //
translated: The ka is not connected after śrī, u, and the letters.

original: shrinya las dang au yig gi mtha' las dang brinya bring dag las dang r'it mtha' las kyang ka rjes su 'brel ba pha rol la ait a'a ga ma mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shrinya las dang au yig gi mtha' las dang brinya bring dag las dang r'it mtha' las kyang ka rjes su 'brel ba pha rol la ait a'a ga ma mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The ka is also connected after śrī, the end of u, and the letters bṛṃ and bṛṅ, and after the end of rīta, but not on the other side.

original: spyi'i thob pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi'i thob pa la'o //
translated: It is for the attainment of the general.

original: a'a shrat:/ a'a shri ta b'an /
analyzed: a'a shrat:/ a'a shri ta b'an /
translated: Āśritaḥ, āśritaḥ pūrvam.

original: kun nas bsten par byas zin to //
analyzed: kun nas bsten par byas zin to //
translated: It is fully relied upon.

original: kun nas bsten par byed zin /
analyzed: kun nas bsten par byed zin /
translated: It is fully relied upon.

original: yu ta:/ yu ta b'an /
analyzed: yu ta:/ yu ta b'an /
translated: Yutaḥ, yutaḥ pūrvam.

original: yu tv'a / bsre bar byas zin la 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o //
analyzed: yu tv'a / bsre bar byas zin la 'gro ba'i don dang las med pa zhes pas kta'o //
translated: katvā, having gone for the sake of beings and having acted

original: nashth'i'o zhes pas kta bantu'o //🔽lu na:/ lu na b'an /
analyzed: nashth'i'o zhes pas kta bantu'o // lu na:/ lu na b'an /
translated: naṣṭvā, having lost🔽katvanta🔽lunāḥ, cut🔽lunāvan, having cut

original: lu tv'a / gcad par byas zin /🔽gcod par byed zin to //
analyzed: lu tv'a / gcad par byas zin / gcod par byed zin to //
translated: lutvā, having cut

original: lu dang ao rjes su 'brel ba zhes pas na nyid do //🔽bri ta:/ bri ta b'an /
analyzed: lu dang ao rjes su 'brel ba zhes pas na nyid do // bri ta:/ bri ta b'an /
translated: lu and o are connected, therefore nyid🔽bṛtāḥ, covered🔽bṛtavan, having covered

original: bri tv'a / bsgribs zin dang gus zin to //🔽t'irna:/ trirna b'an /
analyzed: bri tv'a / bsgribs zin dang gus zin to // t'irna:/ trirna b'an /
translated: bṛtvā, having covered🔽tiṛṇāḥ, having crossed🔽tiṛṇavan, having crossed

original: tv'irtv'a / brgal zin dang bsgral zin to //
analyzed: tv'irtv'a / brgal zin dang bsgral zin to //
translated: tiṛtvā, having crossed

original: r'it mtha'i aira'o //
analyzed: r'it mtha'i aira'o //
translated: ra is the final i of iṛ

original: ra la sa n'ishth'i ta'i zhes pas na nyid do //
analyzed: ra la sa n'ishth'i ta'i zhes pas na nyid do //
translated: ra is connected with la, therefore nyid

original: ka rjes su 'brel ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ka rjes su 'brel ba la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the connection with ka?

original: a'ashra yi t'a /
analyzed: a'ashra yi t'a /
translated: āśrayitā

original: shre ya ti sogs dbyangs gcig pa rnams kyi dgag par bshod do //
analyzed: shre ya ti sogs dbyangs gcig pa rnams kyi dgag par bshod do //
translated: śreyatī, etc. are of one vowel, the prohibition is explained.🔽Therefore,

original: des na // she shri yi ta:/
analyzed: des na // she shri yi ta:/
translated: śreyitā

original: lo lu bi ta:/
analyzed: lo lu bi ta:/
translated: loluvitā

original: shrinya bsten pa la'o //
analyzed: shrinya bsten pa la'o //
translated: śrī is for attending

original: lunya gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: lunya gcod pa la'o //
translated: luñ is for cutting

original: tse kri yi ta zhig par 'gyur ba la kta'i rkyen no //
analyzed: tse kri yi ta zhig par 'gyur ba la kta'i rkyen no //
translated: cet is for destruction, the condition of kat is for the future.

original: aita'o // byings kyi ai yig mtha'i dbyangs dang po la ai ya au wa dag go //
analyzed: aita'o // byings kyi ai yig mtha'i dbyangs dang po la ai ya au wa dag go //
translated: The vowel a is the first of the vowels that follow the syllable i.

original: aurno ti las dgag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: aurno ti las dgag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The prohibition of iṭ is explained:

original: prornu ta b'an /
analyzed: prornu ta b'an /
translated: prorṇutavān.

original: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krit la'o //
analyzed: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krit la'o //
translated: The suffix iṭ is also for kṛt.

original: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krita'i rkyen la ait a'a ga ma mi 'gyur ro //🔽a'i shva ra:/ ka shi pi bh'i sa zhes pas ra'i rkyen no //
analyzed: sgra ldan dang ti dag la'ang krita'i rkyen la ait a'a ga ma mi 'gyur ro // a'i shva ra:/ ka shi pi bh'i sa zhes pas ra'i rkyen no //
translated: The suffix iṭ is also for kṛt, but iṭ does not come after a.🔽āśvasaḥ.🔽The suffix ra is for kṣipibhiḥ.🔽dīpaḥ.

original: d'i pra:/ d'i pi kampi aa dz'i se zhes pas ra'o //
analyzed: d'i pra:/ d'i pi kampi aa dz'i se zhes pas ra'o //
translated: The suffix ra is for dīpikāṃ.🔽dīptiḥ.

original: d'ipti: // bud med la kti'o //
analyzed: d'ipti: // bud med la kti'o //
translated: The suffix iṭ is for a woman.

original: 'o na / ni gri h'i ti:/
analyzed: 'o na / ni gri h'i ti:/
translated: Then,

original: au pa sni hi ta:/
analyzed: au pa sni hi ta:/
translated: nigṛhītiḥ.🔽upasnihitaḥ.🔽bhanitaḥ.

original: bha ni ta:/ ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bha ni ta:/ ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: nany bstan pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nany bstan pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the teaching is impermanent.

original: krit smos pa ni 'dir krit kho na la'o zhes gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: krit smos pa ni 'dir krit kho na la'o zhes gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of kṛt is for the purpose of understanding that it is only for kṛt here.

original: aishu sa ha lu bha ru sha risha rnams kyi ta la yang na'o //
analyzed: aishu sa ha lu bha ru sha risha rnams kyi ta la yang na'o //
translated: The suffix ta is also for iṣu, sah, lubha, ruśa, and ṛṣi.

original: aishu 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: aishu 'dod pa la'o //
translated: iṣu is for desire.

original: sha ha bzod pa la'o //
analyzed: sha ha bzod pa la'o //
translated: saha is for patience.

original: lu bharkam mchags la'o //
analyzed: lu bharkam mchags la'o //
translated: lubha is for greed.

original: ru sha ri sha 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: ru sha ri sha 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: Ruśa and riśa are for injury.

original: 'di rnams kyi ta yig dang po la ait yang na 'gyur ro //🔽'dod do // aesht /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi ta yig dang po la ait yang na 'gyur ro // 'dod do // aesht /
translated: The first of these has iṭ or iṭa.🔽Eṣṭa.

original: aeshi t'a / sva dh'a /
analyzed: aeshi t'a / sva dh'a /
translated: Eṣitā.🔽Svadhā.

original: sa hi t'a /
analyzed: sa hi t'a /
translated: Sahitā.

original: lobdh'a / lo bdhi t'a /🔽rosht'a / roshi t'a /
analyzed: lobdh'a / lo bdhi t'a / rosht'a / roshi t'a /
translated: Lobdhā. Lobdhitā.🔽Roṣṭā. Roṣitā.

original: reshi t'a / aut @313a * //
analyzed: reshi t'a / aut @313a * //
translated: Reṣitā. Uṭ.

original: rjes su 'brel pa dang pung kli sha rnams kyi ktva la'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa dang pung kli sha rnams kyi ktva la'o //
translated: The ktvā suffix is for the following: anuṣaṅga, saṃgha, and kliśa.

original: aut rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang bung dang kli sha dag las kta'i rkyen la ait yang na 'gyur te /
analyzed: aut rjes su 'brel pa rnams dang bung dang kli sha dag las kta'i rkyen la ait yang na 'gyur te /
translated: The ktvā suffix is for the following: anuṣaṅga, saṃgha, and kliśa.

original: shva mi tv'a /
analyzed: shva mi tv'a /
translated: Śamitvā.

original: sh'anta / lnga pa'i au pa dh'a'i zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: sh'anta / lnga pa'i au pa dh'a'i zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: Śānta. The long ā is from the fifth, upaghāta.

original: pa bi tva /
analyzed: pa bi tva /
translated: Pavitvā.

original: pu tv'a / kli shi tv'a /
analyzed: pu tv'a / kli shi tv'a /
translated: Putvā. Kliṣitvā.

original: klishta / kli sha nye bar gdung ba'i don ni gzung bar bya'i rnam par gnod pa'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: klishta / kli sha nye bar gdung ba'i don ni gzung bar bya'i rnam par gnod pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Kliṣṭa. The meaning of kliśa is torment, not harm.

original: sa hi sva ra ri su ti zhes pa'i tshig las yang na zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sa hi sva ra ri su ti zhes pa'i tshig las yang na zhes pa kho na'o //
translated: Sahas, svarī, and suti are only optional.

original: dzr'i bra shtsi dag aita'o //
analyzed: dzr'i bra shtsi dag aita'o //
translated: Jari and vraści have iṭ.

original: yang na zhes pa ldog go //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa ldog go //
translated: Or is the opposite.
